Abdu is a 20-year-old married man who doesn`t have children. He and his wife live together in Ibb, Yemen. He has been operating a construction materials shop for the past three years. He is energetic and hardworking. He has spent a great deal of time improving and developing his business, to ensure that his customers are happy with his services. He works with almost all of the builders in his region. The high quality of his work has helped him gain customers' loyalty and trust.

Abdu applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to continue improving his business. He will use the loan to buy special updated construction materials such as cements, taps, light bulbs, ropes, etc for his business. He works hard to provide his family with the best living and he hopes he can continue to provide excellent service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy special updated building materials such as cements, taps, light bulbs and ropes

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 27-year-old, Lebanese single man. He lives on his own yet he intends to have a family and children. For this reason, he has decided to establish his own freelance business in order to reach his goals. He has been providing legal documentation services and has many customers visiting him to smooth the preparation of their official documents. 

Today, Amer is looking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a photocopy machine and equip his office with the necessary supplies. This Kiva loan will improve his work and allow him to serve more clients. In the future, he plans to enlarge his office and better develop his work.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopy machine and equip his office with the necessary supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. He strives to work really hard in order to enrich their way of living and cover heavy life costs. Ali has been working as a furniture painter since 2002. He has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he has the intention to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his painting tools and develop his business. In that way, he will be able to earn superior income and enhance his life. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to renew his painting tools and develop his business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and two working siblings. He’s the one taking care of his family with the help of his two siblings. 

Ibrahim has owned a coffee shop since 2009 in his town. People meet at his place to enjoy their time with friends, have a coffee and a hubble-bubble (hookah) as well. 

Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added products for his shop such as charcoal, coffee and many others. This will surely increase his sales and allow him to attract added customers. 

In the future, he plans to open a snack shop just next to his coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase added products for his cafe such as charcoal, coffee and many others.

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en:
Rashed is a 23-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He’s doing the best he can to satisfy their demands and live as he should. 

He has been working as a constructor specializing in wall foliage since 2007 and waiting for the perfect time to grow in this field as much as he can. 

Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new construction tools for his business such as wall foliage papers. 

In the future, he plans to open his own wall foliage products shop.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools for his business such as wall foliage papers.

loans.name: Lucine

texts.en:
Lucine is a 27-year-old Lebanese single woman. She’s living with her parents and one working sibling. She’s the one taking care of the family and trying her best to cover all their needs. 

Lucine started to work as a beautician from her home in 2007. She has her loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and stylish beauty designs. 

Today, she’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new cosmetic products such as nail polish, cotton, polish remover and many other items. This will increase her sales by 30%. 

In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetic products such as nail polish, cotton, polish remover and many other items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cherli

texts.es:
Cherli, de 37 años, es una mujer muy activa, siempre está buscando alguna actividad que realizar para así poder generar ingresos para la educación de sus tres hijos, con quienes vive junto a su pareja en casa de su madre. Cherli tiene un trabajo que consiste en la compra y venta de joyas de plata y oro, además de la compra y venta de ropa y venta de abarrotes en general. Ella envía dinero a la ciudad de Lima, de ahí le envían los productos que ella se encarga de vender en la ciudad entre sus amigas y vecinas. Tiene un promedio de nueve años trabajando y lo realiza sola, asimismo tiene una muy buena cartera de clientes. Desde hace solo seis meses inicio su trabajo con la venta de abarrotes y le está yendo muy bien con su inversión.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener tiempo para estar realizando otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que a veces las personas se demoran en pagar, pero siempre tiene clientes y lo bueno es que como ya tiene años en el negocio sabe a quien dar y a quien no. A Cherli le gustaría mas adelante poner una tienda da platería y oro en la ciudad. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1800 soles, comprará mas joyas de plata ya que quiere tener a la moda a sus clientes, además comprará algunos abarrotes para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Cherli, 37 years old, is a very active woman, always looking for something to do to be able to generate income for the education of her 3 children. She lives with them and her husband in her mother's house.

Cherli's business consists of buying and selling silver and gold jewelry, plus clothing and groceries in general. She sends money to the city of Lima and from there, they send products which she attempts to sell in her city among friends and neighbors. Cherli has been working for some 9 years on her own, and she has built up a very good customer list. Some 6 months ago she began selling groceries and the new investment is going well.

Cherli likes the work very much since it leaves her time for other activities. What she doesn't like is that at times, people delay paying. But she always has customers and the good thing is that since she now has years devoted to the business, she knows who to give credit to and who not to. Cherli would like, later on, to establish a silver and gold jewelry store in the city.

This will be her 5th loan through MFP. Cherli is very content to know that she will have financial aid, since she will feel more secure advancing her business. Once again, she is committed to complying with her schedule of payments, as she has with previous loans. In addition, Cherli is very content to belong to her communal bank, since everyone is very responsible and supportive.

With the 1,800 new sols requested, Cherli will purchase more silver jewelry, because she wants to keep her customers in style, and she will buy some groceries to continue in that business.

loans.use: buy more silver jewelry and other products to resupply her store.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a patient mother. She has eight children but lives separately from them. Along with her husband, Adelina runs a business hauling junk and recyclable materials that they resell for a profit. 

Adelina is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to expand her business and buy more used bottles, old newspapers, and boxes to resell. She prays for good health to keep operating her business and save funds to use when emergencies arise.

loans.use: to buy bottles, newspapers, and boxes to re-sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a very active person who is married with six children. She and her husband work hard to help their children achieve their desires in life. Thelma's husband helps her in their sari-sari (variety) business which also has video games. Through her business, Thelma is able to send her children to school. She wants them all to finish because she believes that this is instrumental to improving their standard of living. 

Thelma is requesting a 15,000 PHP  loan to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, vinegar, cooking oil and to maintain her video game machines. Hopefully, her loan will contribute to her higher income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and maintain her video game machines

loans.name: Clesi

texts.es:
Clesi, de 52 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es viuda hace varios años, tiene cinco hijos a quienes crió y educo hasta hacerlos personas de bien en la sociedad, ahora ella vive en su casa propia a lado de una de sus hijas con quien comparte muchas cosas. El trabajo de Clesi, consiste en la venta de golosinas, inter diario se dirige al mercado en busca de dulces, galletas, chupetines y demás golosinas buscados en su negocio, tiene una pequeña vitrina en su casa en donde exhibe y ofrece sus diversos dulces que sirven para endulzar el día como nos dice ella, lleva 5 años en éste negocio el cual empezó a hacerlo debido a que su esposo falleció y debía tener algún ingreso con el cual solventar algunos gastos que tenia, durante el tiempo se estableció económicamente y ahora está empezando recién a hacer crecer su negocio.
Le gusta su trabajo por que es muy relajante para ella, ya que puede conversar con las personas y ya que sus clientes preferidos son los niños, puede jugar y divertirse con ellos, espera seguir trabajando ya que desea seguir juntando su dinero para mas adelante poner una golosinaría mas grande. Este será el crédito número cuatro con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará golosinas y mas productos que ofrecerá a sus clientes, además comenzará a vender bebidas ya que vio que será una fuente extra de ingresos para su economía.
texts.en:
Clesi is 52 years old. She is a good and kind woman and has been a widow for several years. She has five children that she raised and educated to make them good members of society. Now she lives in her own home next to one of her daughters with whom she shares a lot. Clesi's work is selling candies. Every day she goes to the market seeking sweets, cookies, lollipops and other candies sought after in her business. She has a small storefront in her house where she shows and offers the different sweets to sweeten the day, as she tells us. She has had this business for 5 years. She started it because her husband passed away and she had to have some income to pay her expenses. Over time she got financially established and now she is starting to grow her business.   

She likes her work because it is very relaxing for her, since she can talk to people. Her favorite customers are the children, because she can play and have fun with them. She hopes to keep working because she wants to get the money together to open a bigger candy store. This will be her fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, because she will feel safe going ahead in her business. She is committed once more to making her payments on time as she did with the previous loans. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank since all of the members are kind and supportive. With the 1000 soles she has asked for, she will buy candies and more products to offer her customers. She will also begin to sell beverages, since she saw that this will be a source of extra income for her.

loans.use: to buy candies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Razia Begum's Group

texts.en:
Razia begum is a 32-year-old married woman with four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are getting their education from a nearby school. Razia is a very dedicated woman who works very hard in her business so that her children can get a good education and have a bright future. For the past seven years, Razia has operated a decorative embroidery business. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which attract customers. Razia loves her work and does it with full dedication. Her clients are very satisfied with her products and give her regular orders every month. 

Razia is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to buy materials such as beads, colored thread, and cloth for her decorative embroidery business. She will purchase larger quantities of these supplies to enable her to complete orders on time and increase her profit. Razia is hopeful that her loan will improve her business. In this photo, Razia begum is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy materials and cloth for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, spoons, and plates for his restaurant

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is photographed inside her house. She wants to completely finish it.

Fatema is a 47-year-old woman, a mother with three sons and two daughters. She is a worker who gets low salary, but not enough to cover the family's costs as her work is the only source of income for the family.

Fatema is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of completing the house such as: installing windows and doors, installing tiles, and painting. This will improve the house's condition and create better living conditions for Fatema and her family .

loans.use: To complete her house with windows and doors, tiles, etc.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia has the dream of opening her own sari-sari (variety) store but because of financial constraint she pursues her green-grocery business. She is currently selling vegetables in the "barrio" and every Thursday and Sunday she goes to market to sell her wares. This is her opportunity to achieve higher profit from her sales. 



To gain more income, she needs a greater variety of products to sell. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of P9,000 to buy ginger, leafy vegetables, beans and cabbage as additional goods. She hopes for the improvement of her business in order for her to build her own store. That would be less work for her and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy ginger, leafy vegetables, beans and cabbage

loans.name: Rezeq

texts.en:
Rezeq is photographed next to his taxi. He is a 41-year-old man, married and a father with five sons. He has been a taxi driver for 7 years. It has been a profitable project, but also not enough to cover all life's needs.

Rezeq is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the expenses needed to make necessary repairs to the taxi such as: changing the tires, changing the floor mats, changing the engine. This will increase the taxi's efficiency and enable Rezeq to work extra hours and take more internal and external requests which will increase the family income.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to the taxi

loans.name: Mukhtar's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtar is a married woman and a mother of three children who all are young and stay at home. She herself is involved in a sewing & embroidery business. She does this work after finishing her household work. She does the business to cover the household expenses with her husband. 

Her husband has an animal-sales business. He buys young animals from the animal markets and sells them to butchers after raising them. He is very experienced in his business. He has good knowledge about animal breeds and people trust him for his work. He receives good number of orders and earns good profit on each sale. 

Mukhtar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats for reselling. Mukhtar is hopeful that her husband will make good profit from his business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy goats for animals sales business

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Aslı was born in 1982. She is a married woman with three kids. Despite her young age, she manages to take good care of her family and kids. She got to know about Maya when she was selling cosmetics products from her house in order to support and contribute to her family. Her husband was working at Pinar, a Turkish water company. However as time passed, Asli and her husband decided to start their own business. They decided that whatever they did, Aslı would be able to work and to take care of her children at the same time. They decided to do what they knew best so they opened a distributing agency for a water company. This way her husband would keep doing his job and Asli would answer customers' phone calls. Aslı also could have her children with her at the store. 

Aslı and her husband had financial difficulties, but they managed to open their distributing agency. With the loan from Maya, they are able to develop their business further. They are managing to reach more customers. Their dream is to buy other distribution outlets in Eskisehir so that their agency will be one of the main distributing agencies in the area. With this loan, Asli will buy 5 gallon bottled drinking water in bulk for their water distribution store. This business they've started means a lot to them since it is a way to improve their family's living standards.
 
Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteers

Aslı Hanım, 1982 Eskişehir doğumlu evli ve 3 çocuk annesi.Genç yaşına rağmen 3 çocuğunun sorumluluğunu en iyi şekilde yerine getirmeye çalışıyor.  Hem bir anne hem de bir iş kadını .  Aslı Hanım, Maya ile tanıştığında evinden bir makyaj firmasının ürünlerinin satışını yapıyordu ve ailesine bu konuda destek olmaya çalışıyordu eşi ise pınar su bayisinde işçi olarak çalışmaktaydı.  İlerleyen dönemlerde kendi işlerini kurmak istediler ve bu konuda fikir üretmeye başlayınca şöyle bir karar aldılar öyle bir iş yapmalıydılar ki Aslı Hanım, çocuklarının da yanında olmalıydı ve aynı zamanda işinin başında olmalıydı.  Sonunda yapıcakları işe karar verdiler eşinin en iyi yaptığı ve bildiği iş içme suyu dağıtım işiydi ve bir bayi açabilirlerse hem eşi işini yapıcak hemde Aslı Hanım, bu iş yerinin başında duracak işleri yürütecekti.  Maddi konuda çok sıkıntılar çekmelerine karşı yinede bayilik başvurusu aldılar ve eşi dağıtıma bakarken aslı hanımda dükkanın başında durup telefonla müşterilerin adreslerin siparişleri aldı ve bu süreçte çocukları da dükkanda yanındaydı.  Maya'dan çektikleri kredi ile damacana sayısını çoğalttılar ve böylelikle daha fazla insana ulaşabilecekler şimdi en büyük hayalleri Eskişehirde ki birçok bölgenin bayiliğini alıp ana bayilerden biri olabilmek.Eşiyle beraber başladıkları bu iş onların ve çocuklarının geleceği insanlara su satarak hizmet verdikleri bu iş aslında onların can suyu oldu.

loans.use: to buy 5 gallon bottled drinking water in bulk for her outlet store

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma was born in 1970 in Sivrihisar. She is married with three children. Her husband is a civil servant and two of her children study at university. The other one goes to high school. She began her business life when her children's educational expenses increased. She wasn't happy with only her husband working, because she wanted to contribute to her family’s budget, so she stepped into the business world. Firstly, she started to work in a textile factory. At the beginning of her job in the textile factory, she did delivery and shift work. She found the job hard, but she didn't give up because if she quit her job, she wouldn't be able to support her children's education, and she was encouraged by this thought. 

After that, she got the best job opportunity of her life. She partnered with the owner of a tailor shop with the help of someone close to her. She dedicated herself to this job. Later, her partner opened a new shop, so Fatma became the owner of the original shop. 

Her biggest dream is to be an expert at her job and she wants to make her own shop a fashion house. She doesn't want her husband's contribution, because she wants to do everything by herself. She financed the rest of the shop with the Maya loan, as well as repairing the machines in the shop. She appreciates the Maya loan through Kiva and has shown that she has developed her business and is determined to continue to do so in the future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteers

Fatma Hanim 1970 Sivrihisar doğumlu. Evli ve 3 çocuk annesi . Eşi memur ve çocuklarının ikisi ünv.öğrencisi birisi lise. Fatma Hanım ,iş hayatına çocuklarının eğitim masrafları vb arttığında başlamış.Memur olarak çalışmakta olan eşinin tek maaşla evi geçindirmesine gönlü razı olmayan Fatma Hanım, hem kendi ayaklarının üzerinde durup hem de aile bütçesine katkıda bulunmak isteyince iş hayatına adım atmış. Bir giyim fabrikasında dikiş nakış üzerine çalışmaya başlamış ilk dönem bu işi öğrenene kadar getir götür işlerine bakmış ,vardiyalı çalışmış,bu konuda çok zorluklar çektiğini dile getiriyor fakat vazgeçmemiş çünkü çocuklarının eğitimi için çalışmak zorunda olmak onu hep daha çok kamçılamış. Fabrikanın zor çalışma şartlarına rağmen işini bırakmamış taki önüne hayatının fırsatı olarak tanımladığı terzi dükkanı çıkana kadar bir yakının aracılığı ile tanıştığı bir terzi dükkanına ortak olarak başlayan Fatma Hanım, daha da severek özenle işine sarılmış yanındaki ortağının bir başka yerde terzi dükkanı açıp gitmesiyle şu anda çalıştırdığı dükkan tamamen kendisine kalmış. Fatma Hanımın, en büyük hayali bu konuda çok iyi olmak ve dükkanını ileride bir moda evi durumuna getirebilmek bunu yaparken de eşinden maddi destek almak istemiyor çünkü eşi aile geçimini sağlıyor ve Fatma Hanım işi konusunda herşeyi kendi başarmak istiyor. Maya’dan kredi kullanarak dükkanının bir kirasını ödedi ve makinalarının bakımını yaptırabildi. Maya’ya minnettar olduğunu dile getiren Fatma Hanım ,azmiyle ve işine bağlılığıyla başarıya ulaşabileceğini şimdiden gösteriyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 57 and works selling fresh vegetables and fruit. She has been operating her business for over one year and she sells in the barrio as well as the market to improve her income.

Beatriz is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to purchase fruits such as bananas and cucumber, and vegetables such as cabbage and potatoes. Her loan will help improve her everyday income. Beatriz hopes to expand her business and have a better way of living to save funds for her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 38 years old, married and has two children. Both attend school. His spouse provides manicure services to the people in their neighborhood. Ricky plants and harvests rice to sell. He had been in his farming business for almost 20 years. 

He would like to improve his farming output but he has insufficient funds so he is borrowing a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides use in farming.

Ricky prays for good health to continuously provide sustenance for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
A determined man named Romeo is expressing his gratefulness for having a supportive wife and two children. They own a farming business and it serves as the family's primary source of income. They plant and harvest rice to sell. They have been in this business for almost 20 years.

As of now, he has insufficient funds for his farming business so he is borrowing a loan of P35,000 to buy 6 bags of UREA (fertilizer) and 5 bags of rice seeds for use in farming. 

With his hard work and the help of this loan, Romeo knows that someday he will attain success and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of UREA (fertilizer) and 5 bags of rice seeds for use in farming

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46 years old and has nine children. Only two attend school. With her spouse, Dante, she cultivates a hectare plot of land. They plant and harvest rice in it and sell the rice to traders. With their income from the business, they are very happy to be able to sustain their needs for education, bills and meals for the family. Lolita would like to increase their crop production so she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming.

In the future, Lolita hopes to achieve plentiful crops every harvest and save funds to use when emergency arises and invest part of the profit in a hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming

loans.name: Sharifan's Group

texts.en:
Sharifan is 37-year-old married woman and by this relationship she has seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a worker in a factory on monthly wage. He financially contributes to the family from his earnings.  Her husband has a motor workshop where he repairs different vehicles like motorbikes and cars. He is very talented man. His clients are very satisfied with his work. 

Sharifan herself is a very dedicated woman. She operates a decoration pieces sales business. She does this work to supplement the income for her family. Her collection of decorative mirrors and vases are her main items. She has good demand for her decoration pieces among her customers. She earns good profit on each piece. 

Sharifan has been doing this work for over 10 years and has got a good reputation among her customers for her good range of items.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her decoration pieces sales business. She will invest the loan in buying of decoration pieces (mirrors and vases) in larger quantity for reselling. She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sharifan.

loans.use: To buy decoration pieces for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 28 and 15 years. Two of them go to school. 

Mary runs a mixed food store business and a grinding machine for flour, and she has been in the business for five years. She has one employee. Mary heard about Finance South Sudan through fellow clients, the promotion done in the market by the loan officers, and a radio advert.

She is taking a loan of 2,500 to purchase more items like cassava flour, maize, grain, sorghum, and many others. In addition to this business, Mary has a grinding machine for flour as another source of income.

In five years' time, Mary has hopes for building her house.

Her major challenges include low income rate and day to day changes in prices of goods in the whole sale market.

Mary says that she appreciates Finance South Sudan’s support in South Sudan, which has helped many women to start up a business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like, cassava flour, maize, grain, sorghum and many others.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha de 42 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Américo, su esposo desde hace  20 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Salir adelante es muy difícil, sobre todo por sus hijos a quienes cuida con mucho esmero. Pero cada 15 días viaja a la capital del país donde compra lencería para mujeres y losetas para piso, su forma de trabajo es vender la mercadería 2 veces al mes a la ciudad de Satipo (selva central peruana), donde tiene muchos clientes, pues en esa zona no existen muchas tiendas de lencería fina y losetas, ya tiene 6 años dedicándose a ello, y es muy conocida. “Mis hijos están creciendo y quiero que estudien en una universidad reconocida”, afirma. Por ello trabaja muy duro, pero no se siente sola porque recibe el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como electricista en una mina reconocida. Ella tiene que coincidir cada 20 días en su casa pues, su esposo llega para pasar tiempo en familia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y este es el décimo segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Mirtha de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 42, is a modest woman.  She lives with Américo, her husband of 20 years.  Together they have three children whom she raises in their own house, located in the town of Chilca.

Getting ahead is very hard, especially because of her children, for whom she cares with great effort.  But every two weeks she goes to the capital where she buys women's lingerie and floor tiles.  She sells the merchandise twice a month in the city of Satipo (in the central jungle area of Peru), where she has a lot of customers, because in that area there are not many fine lingerie or floor tile stores.  She has been doing this work for six years already and she is very well known.

"My children are growing up and I want them to study in a recognized university," she says.  This is why she works very hard.  But she does not feel alone because she receives the support of her husband, who works as an electrician in a well-known mine.  She has to go home every 20 days because her husband arrives to spend time with the family.

She belongs to the La Florida solidarity group and this is her tenth loan with MFP, where she feels empowered because she gets the help to get ahead with her business.  This is why she promises to be punctual in making her payments.  In addition, she likes to work in her bank because they are responsible and supportive people.

If she receives her support, Mirtha will invest the requesting money in buying merchandise to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles as well as lingerie.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de ser amable y cordial, es separada del padre de su hija de 7 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su papá, mamà, su hija y sus 4 hermanos a los que quiere mucho, habitando la casa de sus padres. Las a actividad que realiza Blanca, es la venta de ropa y sandalias  de damas y caballeros,  para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos cada mes a la capital, donde realiza sus compras buscando los mejores precios y modelos ò en ocasiones le envía su tía quien vive en esa ciudad, para luego venderlos entre sus amistades de manera personal. También vende productos de belleza que comprar por catálogos, donde tiene bastante pedidos de sus amistades y familiares, realizando estos negocios desde hace 03 años realizándola ella sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hija, y los considera rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Antes tenía problemas económicos, pues se separó del padre de su hija,  y no recibía pensión para los gastos. Pero desde que empezó a trabajar a tenido muchas satisfacciones gracias a su negocio, por ello desea ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer, abriendo una boutique en la casa de sus padres. Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse a gusto con banco comunal pues considera a  su grupo ser unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y sandalias de diversos modelos y tallas, traídos de la capital,  buscando los precios más bajos y así tener mayores ganancias, ya que cuenta con pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
Blanca, aged 30, as a diligent and hard-working woman, who is also friendly and cordial.  She is separated from the father of her seven-year-old daughter.  She lives in her parents' house with her dad, mom, daughter and her four brothers, whom she loves very much.  

The work that Blanca does is selling women's and men's clothing and sandals.  To do this, she makes periodical trips each month to the capital, which is where she makes her purchases, looking for the best prices and fashions, or on occasion she sends her aunt who lives in the city.  She then sells her products personally to her friends.  She also sells beauty products, which she purchase from catalogs when she has sufficient orders from family and friends.  She has been working with these businesses for the last three years, and does it on her own.  She enjoys her busines, because it generates income to meet household expenses and education costs for her daughter.  She considers it to be successful because of the good profits that it provides.

She had financial problems earlier on, as when she separated from her daughter's father, she didn't receive any allowance from him for expenses.  But since then, she has had great satisfaction thanks to her business.  This is why she wants to expand her business and make it grow, opening a boutique in her parents' home.

This will be her fourth loan with the MFP institution, which is why she hopes for your participation, so that she can make her plans become real.  She also really enjoys the communal bank, as she considers her group to be united and supportive of each other.

With the requested amount of 1,500 new soles, she will invest in purchasing different fashions and sizes of clothing and sandals, as she orders to fill.  She will bring the items from the capital, where she will search out the lowest prices and in this way have better profits.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a farmer living in the Philippines. He is raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He is married and has three children attending school. He would like to improve his farming practices and his output but he needs additional capital. He is now borrowing a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help ensure proper growth of crops in his rice field. 

Someday, with good profits from the business, he will attain a successful life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is photographed inside her house with her husband and her newborn son. She is a 37-year-old woman, a mother with three sons and one daughter. She has a project of making home-made pastries, which is a profitable project.

Hanadi is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of resolving moisture problems and rot at her home which threats her family with catching diseases. This will improve the family's house conditions and offer them healthy conditions to live in.

loans.use: To solve moisture problems and rot at their home

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 45 years old. She is married and has four children.

She earns a living by selling fruits and vegetables in the village. She is requesting PHP 4,000 to purchase "camote" tops, bananas, squash and string beans to sell.  She has been doing this tirelessly for over four years. She believes that this is the secret of attaining her objective: to send all her children to school and experience a better living standard.

loans.use: to purchase "camote" tops, bananas, squash and string beans

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 63-year-old man, married and a father with five sons. 

For the past 30 years, Khaled has been selling wrist watches and accessories, which has been a profitable project.

Khaled is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of making some changes and improvements to his store such as: installing new shelves and cupboards, painting, and installing lights and ceiling decoration. This will create a more modern image for the store and attract new customers, which will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To improve the store's condition.

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали житель города Вахдат. Ему 60 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Курбонали сорок лет работает по профессии, преподавателем. Также он занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Kurbonali is a resident of the village Vahdat. He is 60 years old and married. He has two children. Kurbonali has worked as a teacher for 40 years. He is also engaged in crop cultivation. He has been engaged in this type of activity for ten years. He takes a loan for sowing wheat and to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel for his tractor.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel for his tractor.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Borrower Narantsetseg is a 47-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a small apartment. She has operated a food stall business for 16 years at a local indoor market. Her husband is an on-call plumbing manager, and his business is very popular during the spring, summer and autumn. 

Now it’s the beginning of spring season; therefore, he needs some tools for operating his business besides his wife’s income. Their daughter studies at the local university, so the family needs study fees. 

Thus, Narantsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase necessary plumbing tools for her spouse’s business.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing tools for her husband.

loans.name: Akramsho

texts.ru: Акрамшо проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Образование у него высшее. По специальности он инженер. Акрамшо занимается разведением мелко - рогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа овец и коз.
texts.en: Akramsho lives in the Dangara district.  He is 26 years old, married and has a higher education.  He is an engineer.  Akramsho is involved in breeding small livestock.  He is requesting this loan to buy sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Махмадали житель района Дангара. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его дети учатся в школе. Он более восьми лет занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mahmadali is a resident of the Dangara district.  He is 38 years old, married and has six children.  His children attend a school.  Mahmadali has been involved in animal husbandry for over eight years.  He is requesting this loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar, de 51 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora, es conviviente co su pareja y tiene dos hijos de 25 y 12 años, vive en su casa propia y trabaja mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. EL trabajo de Pilar consiste en la crianza de aves de corral, tiene dos galpones en un distrito muy cerca de la ciudad, es ahí a donde va todos los días con la compañía de su pareja a verificar y alimentar a sus animales, su promedio de producción es de 1500 pollos cada 45 días que el tiempo de promedio de días que dura la crianza desde que son pollos bebes hasta que salen al mercado. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 5 años aproximadamente y es algo que aprendió poco a poco. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le da tiempo de hacer algunas cosas mas, ya que solo utiliza la mitad del día para estar en los galpones y el resto del día está en su casa a lado de sus hijos y ayudándolos en las cosas que necesitan, cada día se convence mas que el trabajo que tiene es muy buen, ya que tiene muchos clientes fijos quienes están en espera de que salga la producción del mes para comprar sus pollos que son grandes, gordos y saludables, ahora se prepara para ampliar con un galpón mas y está convencida que en base a arduo trabajo logrará seguir creciendo. Este será el crédito número 13 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración par continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado ella se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo, además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, comprará pollos bebes para seguir con su crianza, además refaccionará algunas cosas de los galpones en donde cría a sus aves.
texts.en: Pilar is 51 years old. She is a good, kind and enterprising woman. She lives with her spouse and has two children, aged 25 and 12. She lives in her own house and works hard to offer a better quality of life to her family. Pilar's work is raising poultry. She has two sheds very close to the city and she goes there every day with her spouse to check on and feed her animals. Her average production is 1,500 chickens every 45 days, which is the average time needed to raise the chicks to be ready for market. She has dome this job for approximately 5 years and it is something she learned little by little. She likes her work because it gives her time to do more things. She only uses half the day to be in her sheds and the rest of the day she is at home with her children helping them with anything they need. Every day she is more convinced that the work she does is good, since she has a lot of regular customers who wait for her monthly production because her chickens are big, plump and healthy. Now she is preparing to have one more shed and she is convinced that with her hard work she will keep growing. This will be her 13th loan with MFP. She hopes for your cooperation to continue with her goals. She is also committed to making her payments on time as with the previous loans. She also wants to keep working with the members of the communal bank because they are all kind and supportive. With the 4000 soles she has asked for, she will buy chicks to raise. She will also replace some things in the sheds where she raises her birds.

loans.use: to buy chicks and materials to raise chickens.

loans.name: Naseem Begum's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Begum is a 39-year-old married woman. By this relationship she has three children, one daughter and two sons.  All of her children are enrolled in school and getting an education. 

Naseem Begum is a seamstress. Her work is home-based. She receives regular orders every month from her clients and earns an income. She does this work to supplement the income for her family.  

Her husband is a government employee and receives a monthly wage. 

Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She will invest the loan amount in buying a new sewing machine because her old machine doesn’t produce quality work. 

Naseem is hopeful that with a new machine, she will be able to fulfill her orders on time and earn good revenue from this.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela, age 50, is a very helpful and determined mother. She has four children, all of whom attend school. She earns an income from her hog-raising business. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years now. She is thankful for her business. 

Graciela  would like to keep developing her business so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs. 

Some day, with good profits and good financial management, she will create a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina's goal in life is to provide a better quality of life for her family, especially for her children. She and her husband are working together to achieve this goal.

Cristina is 43 years of age, married, and has two children attending school. She runs a clothing business where she sells a variety of clothes in the market. Her husband is a farmer and her partner for growth in her business through advice and moral support.

With her desire to send her children to school through college, Cristina works hard to earn extra income and sustain her children's needs in school. She would like a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional items of clothing to sell in the market. She hopes to earn a higher income and further support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional items of clothing to sell in the market.

loans.name: Lourinda

texts.en:
Lourinda happily lives in Alimannao with her spouse and three children. To earn a living, the couple sells junk and other recyclable materials for profits. This way, they can provide for their children and other needs of the family. 

Lourinda is in need of additional capital so she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more used bottles, plastics and empty cans to resell.

Some day, she hopes to continuously finance the education of her children. She would be very happy and proud if this dream came true.

loans.use: to buy more used bottles, plastics and empty cans to resell.

loans.name: Kristelita

texts.en:
Kristelita owns and manages a small store in front of her house at Libag Sur. She is 44 years old and married and has one child. 

Kristelita patiently attends to her customers' needs. She is thankful for all her customers who patronize her store. She would like to keep improving her services and her sales, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy sugar, biscuits, soft drinks and noodles to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, biscuits, soft drinks and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a wise person who will not stop trying until she succeeds. She started her business selling glassware at the age of 32. Now, she is 52 and has already been running her business for 20 years. Her inspiration in running her business for such a long time is her family. She wants to raise her family out of poverty.

Rosa is married and blessed with six children. Her husband is also a vendor in the market. When she started her business she experienced some failures, but she did not lose hope. Now, Rosa is happy to report that her business is doing well. Through the income she earns, she is able to provide her children allowances in school.

Rosa wants to maintain and gain a higher income from her business, which is why she decided to take a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy kitchen utensils to sell in the market. She hopes to receive the loan and maintain the business as her source of income.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to sell in the market.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is motivated to work hard by her favorite saying: try and fail, but don’t fail to try. Jovita is 58 years old, married, and blessed with one child. Her husband is a farmer working in the Philippines. Jovita runs a sari-sari (variety) store business.

With her desire to earn a higher income and have a better quality of life, Jovita started another business, which is cooking glutinous rice to sell in the market.  She is happy that she has kept this business going for 23 years now.

Jovita wants to earn more income to save for her family in case of future emergencies. She wishes that she could sell more glutinous rice in the market, but she doesn’t have enough capital to make her wish a reality. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy glutinous rice, sugar, wrappers, and some other ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, sugar, wrappers, and some other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, age 44, is borrowing PHP 6,000 from ASKI as additional working capital for her piggery business. It will be used to purchase feed, vitamins, and medicine. This will be a big help in improving her income, as well as her family's living conditions. 

In addition to raising pigs, Norma buys and sells bananas. She patiently does such activities for her family. Norma aspires to save enough money for the education of her four children and to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old, married, and has two children who attend college. She is a business-minded person. When she got married, Evelyn started a hog raising business where she earned enough income to allow her to start another business of buying and selling rice and corn. She has been in this business for five years and earns a higher income. 

Evelyn is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy rice and corn to sell in her village.  She wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn..

loans.name: Nizami

texts.ru: Nizami jenat, emu 54 goda, u nego 3 detey vozrastov ot 14 do 19. On vmeste s jenoy zanimaetsa selskoxozaystvennim delom. Oni prodayut sherst, moloko i masyo, ix klienti eto mestnie jiteli. Nizami nadeetsa rasshirit svoy biznes, chtobi ego deti smogli polucit uchebu. On stroit  dom dla semyi i iza finansovix trudnostey emu prishlos priostonovit stroyku i oni jivut v dome bez udobstv.  Segodna emu nujni 800 AZN dla zaversheniya postroyki doma. Nizami nadeetsa na ponimanie i zarane vsem blagodoren.
texts.en: Nizami is married, he is 54 years old and he has 3 children ages from 14 to 19.  Together with his wife he is engaged in farming. They sell leather, milk and meat to local customers. Nizami is hoping to expand his business to be able to pay for his children's education. He's also building a house for the family and because of financial difficulties he had to pause the construction and the family is living in a house without basic amenities. Nizami is asking for 800AZN loan to be able to complete his house.  Nizami is hoping for your understanding, support and is thankful to lenders.

loans.use: To finish the building of house.

loans.name: Mushkinaz

texts.en:
Mushkinaz is 46 years old married woman and she has four children ages 15 to 21.
The scope of her employment is agriculture, in which she has been engaged for 8 years. 
She sells the meat at a bazaar; her family helps her to do it. She wants to expand her business in future.
Mushkinaz's daughter is getting married and she wants to obtain 1,000 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to buy furniture for her. Being a very responsible woman, she hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her daughter.

loans.name: Alam

texts.en: Alam is 45 years-old, married and has 4 children. He is an 16 years experienced taxi driver. Now he wants to start the fruit and vegetable trading business. Alam wants to obtain for 1000 AZN so he will able to become true his plans. The additional income will help him to support his family better.

loans.use: To buy the inventory for his fruit and vegetable trading business

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita works hard to support her family. She is married and blessed with four children. She is in the business of buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Jovita has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more goods such as eggplant, onions, garlic, tomatoes and squash. Hopefully, she would save enough funds to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as eggplant, onions, garlic, tomatoes and squash

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is a 32-year-old divorced man, a worker with a low salary, but not enough to cover all his costs.

To prepare himself  to get married again, Bahaa is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of finishing his house, such as: installing tiles, painting, and installing lights. This will offer Bahaa suitable and comfortable house conditions as he is preparing to get married soon and move to live in it.

Bahaa is photographed next to his house.

loans.use: To complete his house.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita, aged 42, works hard to provide sustenance for her family. She had been selling fruit and vegetables in her village for almost four years now. She only generates a minimal income from her business. This encouraged her to ask for a loan of P7,000  to buy cucumber, eggplant, bitter melon and root crops. She hopes to improve her sales to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cucumber, eggplant, bitter melon and root crops

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 49 years of age and engaged in a hog fattening business. This is her source of income as well as her way to help her husband in providing their food. In her situation, she also aspires for a comfortable life soon.

In this matter, she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicine to maintain her business. She is hoping that through the loan, she will be able to increase her sales as she disposes of her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicine to maintain her business

loans.name: Zubaida Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida bibi is a 48-year-old talented lady. She owns & operates a sewing & embroidery business at her home which she does to financially contribute to the family. She is very good in her work. She keeps herself up-to-date about the latest trends and fashions which helps her understand her customers' choices and demand. 

Her husband has a business selling animals. He buys young animals and sells them after raising them for a good profit. He has been in this business for many years. He has obtained a good reputation among his clients. His good knowledge about the animal breeds helps attract many other customers towards him and allows him to get good orders.  

Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy young goats & buffalo to sell. Zubaida is hopeful about the positive financial growth of her husband’s business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy goats & buffalo for animal sales business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 33-year-old who dreams of a comfortable life someday. Her dream leads her to strive harder in earning an income. She has a sari-sari (variety) store that provides enough income to cover her family's daily expenses. She has been in this business for almost ten years and she is aiming for a better income from it. 

To make this possible, she is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy additional stocks of groceries for her store such as spices, soft drinks, candies, and washing soap. She strongly believes that with this loan, she will be able to develop her business and eventually obtain her dream.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries for her store such as spices, soft drinks, candies, and washing soap.

loans.name: Razia Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Razia Sultana is a 40-year-old married woman and she has four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education at a nearby school. Razia and her husband know the value of education, which is why they work hard so that their children can get a good education and make their futures secure and bright.

Razia owns and operates a clothing and embroidery business. Her work is home-based. She receives orders from her community clients and earns income for the family. Her husband runs a grocery store where he serves people from the community. His good business sense and fair dealing always get priority among his customers for purchasing. 

Razia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. She will use the loan to buy a new sewing machine because her current machine takes a lot of time to sew a single dress and does not produce quality work. Razia is hopeful that with this investment she can expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa est couturière de profession, elle est mariée et âgée de 37 ans et s’active depuis 3 ans. Son atelier se trouve à proximité du guichet. Awa possède 5 machines et emploie 2 tailleurs dans son atelier. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500000 F CFA  pour pouvoir acheter une autre machine et des tissus à la mode afin de confectionner des ensembles, les exposer pour les revendre. Puisque l’atelier est un peu large, elle profite de l’occasion pour y vendre aussi des friperies (habits comme chaussures).
Les bénéfices de son activité sont réservés à améliorer les conditions d’études de ses enfants car l’avenir des parents c’est les enfants et  c’ est aussi un investissement à long terme.
texts.en:
Awa is a professional seamstress. She is married, 37 years old, and has been working for three years. Her studio is close to the bank branch. Awa has five machines and employs two tailors in her studio. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs to be able to buy another machine and fabrics that are in style in order to create outfits and display them to resell them. Since the studio is a bit big, she is taking advantage of the situation and also selling used clothes and shoes there.
The earnings from her business are set aside to improve the conditions of her children's education, because the parents' future is their children, and it's also a long term investment.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make ready to wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando es una persona que a pesar de las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y seguir adelante junto con su familia. Desde muy temprana edad inició a trabajar en la actividad de la agricultura, pues su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y desde muy temprana edad se la enseño. Orlando actualmente se encuentra casado y es padre de 3 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación. Orlando desde que empezó a trabajar inició ahorrando sus ingresos, y poco a poco ahorrando logró completar el dinero que requería para comprar una finca y poder sembrar sus cultivos en ella, sin embargo, conflictos de violencia en su región hicieron que abandonara su finca y sus cultivos y buscara un nuevo lugar donde hospedarse con su familia. Fue así como le regalaron un curso donde le enseñaron a cosechar frutas y cítricos y decidió montar un cultivo con estos productos. Con el ánimo de sacar su nuevo cultivo adelante Orlando busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos y materias primas que necesita para su cultivo.

Orlando espera que de esta manera pueda salir adelante con su cultivo y pueda generar ingresos con los que su familia pueda gozar de una buena calidad de vida. Además, Orlando sueña con que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación universitaria y sueña con dejarles una finca en buenas condiciones con la que puedan garantizar una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Orlando is a person who, in spite of life’s adversities, has had the strength to overcome them and get ahead with his family.  He started working in agriculture at a very young age.  His father devoted himself to this business activity, and his father taught him when Orlando was very young. 

Orlando is now married and has three children.  He has always wanted to provide them with a good education.  Ever since he started working Orlando began saving his income.  By saving little by little he managed to get the money he needed to buy a farm and be able to grow crops on it.    However, violent conflicts in his region made him abandon the farm and his crops.  

This caused him to look for a new place to stay with his family.  This was how he was given a course where that taught him to grow fruits and citrus.  He decided to start growing these products.  With the intention of getting ahead with his crops, Orlando seeks a loan.  The loan will provide him with the opportunity to buy supplies and raw materials that he needs for his crops.

Orlando hopes that this way he will be able to get ahead with his crops.  He hopes that he will be able to generate income so that his family is able to enjoy a better quality of life.  Also, Orlando dreams that his children will be able to access a university education.  He dreams of leaving them a farm that is in good condition, which will be able to ensure financial stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials that he needs for his crops.

loans.name: Ricardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre humilde y trabajador que se dedicaba a la actividad del reciclaje para subsistir, lo cual hizo por muchos años. A través de un programa con una fundación descubrió que tenía un gran espíritu emprendedor y decidió aprovechar el hecho de que su vivienda está ubicada en una esquina de la principal vía de su barrio. Ha sido muy pro-activo y ha luchado fuertemente para establecerse en su negocio. Se vio envuelto en una circunstancia adversa de que el gobierno quería cerrar su negocio con el motivo de que estaba invadiendo el espacio público, sin embargo, luego de recoger más de 100 firmas y recibir asesoría legal logró defender su caso y ahora tiene los respectivos permisos. Ricardo busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de comprar materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio, las cuales le prometió a la entidad del gobierno que vigila y regula el uso del espacio público. 

Ricardo espera seguir con su negocio adelante y hacerlo prosperar en su sector. Además, Ricardo tiene el sueño de ser un profesional e ir a la universidad, pagando sus estudios con los ingresos que obtiene de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a humble, hard-working man who worked for many years in recycling. Through a programme run by a foundation, he discovered that he has a great entrepreneurial spirit. He decided to take advantage of the fact that his home is located on the corner of the main street in his neighbourhood. He has been very proactive and has worked hard to establish his business. He had to confront a difficult situation; the government wanted to close his business for invading public space. However, after collecting over 100 signatures and getting legal advice, he was able to defend himself and he now has the necessary permissions. Ricardo hopes that a loan will provide him with the ability to buy construction materials to make some improvements to his business. He promised the government body that regulates the use of public space that he would make these improvements.
Ricardo hopes to keep improving his business and to prosper. His dream is to be a professional and to go to university, paying his tuition with the income from his business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to make improvements to his business.

loans.name: Sandra Catalina

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven emprendedora que a la corta edad de 19 años ya ha montado su propio negocio y trabaja fuertemente para sacarlo adelante. Sandra se dedica a la confección de su propia línea de prendas de vestir las cuales comercializa en su municipio y en otros municipios cercanos. Actualmente estudia diseño de modas y con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado su propia marca de prendas de vestir adelante. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha podido captar un gran número de clientes, los que le garantizan unos grandes niveles de ventas. Su negocio lo montó hace 2 años y debido al poco capital con el que lo montó ha visto la necesidad de incrementar su capacidad de producción para responder a todos los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Es por esto que Sandra busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos para la confección como telas e hilos y poder aumentar la capacidad productiva de su negocio para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Sandra espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y siga saliendo adelante, de modo que pueda cumplir su sueño de tener su propio negocio que sea muy reconocido en el país y desde el cual pueda generar mucho empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Sandra is a young entrepreneur. At the young age of 19, she has already established her own business and she works very hard to maintain it. Sandra sews her own line of clothing, which she sells in her municipality and in other nearby municipalities. She is currently studying fashion design; with great hard work, she has made her own line successful. Thanks to the high quality of her products, she has been able to capture a large section of the market. These clients guarantee her a large level of sales. 
Sandra opened her business two years ago. She started off with a very small amount of working capital, so she has found it necessary to increase her production capacity in order to fill all of her clients' orders. For this reason, Sandra is requesting a loan. This loan will offer her the opportunity to buy the tools she needs, such as fabric and thread, and to increase her business' production capacity in order to fill all of her clients' orders.
Sandra hopes that her business will continue to grow and succeed thanks to this loan; and that she will be able to reach her dream of having her own business which is well-known throughout the country, and which will generate a great deal of employment for those who most need it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for dressmaking, such as fabric and thread, in order to increase production and fill orders.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina is a 54-year-old woman, married with three daughters. She is an honest and hard-working woman. She is a widow and is raising her children alone.

Zamina has been reselling jewelry for the last seven years. She started her business with a tiny amount of money and with several loans from AqroInvest CU, expanding slowly. As she is raising her children on her own, it is hard for her to provide for them and she always needs support. Every morning Zamina leaves home and comes back late at night. The money which she makes is only enough for day-to-day spending and it's hard for her to save for the future. 

For this reason Zamina would like to take out a loan of 1800 AZN to purchase more jewelry in bulk and expand her business, increasing her profits and improve living conditions for her family. This will be her fourth loan and she has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Sana is a 37-year-old single woman. Her brother is a judge with a low salary, and so she sews clothes at home for customers which is a profitable project that helps her to support herself and cover her daily costs and needs.

Sana is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new sewing machine. This will help Sana to improve the quality of her work and satisfy her customers, increase sales and improve her income.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Dahlia Makmur Group

texts.en:
Derliana is married with four children. She is pictured wearing an orange T-shirt. She has been selling "Sembako" - "sembilan bahan pokok" (Indonesian terms for nine daily basic needs such as rice, oil, salt, sugar and milk) since 2010. She runs this business to have extra income to add to the income from her husband as a teacher to provide more nutrition for the children. Her business is running smoothly and she plans to use her part of the loan to buy more rice, eggs, oil, sugar and also snacks to sell. In the future she wants her business to grow so she can have more supplies in her store. She also hopes she can send all of her children to university. 

Other group members are using their part of the loan to sell cookies and to sell cell phone minute refills.

loans.use: to pay for more rice, eggs, oil, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Karry Esmenia

texts.en:
Karry Esmenia is 34, married, and blessed with two children. She has a stall in the market where she sells a variety of meat. The products she offers are of great quality and affordable prices. This helps her acquire loyal customers.  And as time has passed, she has gained many customers. 

Karry Esmenia wants to expand her product line and provide her customers a larger variety of fresh meat. So, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pork, chicken, and vegetables as additional goods to offer. With her loan and excellent service, she knows that someday she will provide her family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken, and vegetables as additional goods to offer.

loans.name: Phok

texts.en:
Phok's main activity is crop husbandry. She grows rice, potatoes, beans, and a few types of vegetable on her own farm in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. Phok is now 52 years old and has a common law relationship with her husband who works in the construction field. Together, this couple has been blessed with five children. Two of them are already married and live independently. 

With the amount she requested from HKL, she will pay for the process of cultivating potatoes on a three hectare plantation in a new cycle. This loan will enable Phok to sustain her business and make a stable living for her family. She plans to save some money to expand her farm land and achieve great farming productivity.

loans.use: to pay for the process of cultivating potatoes on a three hectare plantation in a new cycle.

loans.name: Denie

texts.en: Denie, age 36, is an entrepreneurial woman who is seriously aiming to move forward in life. She is determined to achieve all her objectives, such as experiencing a good quality of life. Her two children serve as her motivation in pursuing her retail business.  She wants to expand her business, but unfortunately she suffers from financial constraints. This is why she decided to request a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase biscuits, instant noodles, beverages, breads, and soft drinks. She is very sure that these products will allow her to earn higher profits and to offer a better future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, instant noodles, beverages, breads, and soft drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maiquel

texts.es:
Maiquel, de 33 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y decidido con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es separado de la madre de su hija. Viven en casa de sus padres en compañía de su mamà, papá, y 5 hermanos a quienes apoya. La actividad que realiza Maiquel es el servicio de transporte, para eso cuenta con 3 mototaxi que  alquila a sus vecinos cobrando hasta 20 soles por día.  Empezó de muy joven hace más de 7 años alquilando un mototaxi, con las ganancias fue pagando las cuotas de ese vehiculo hasta que llego a ser de su propiedad, continuado con la compra de un segundo vehiculo, hasta tener 3 unidades. También estudio mecánica de motos, brindando mantenimiento a sus propios vehículos y en ocasiones a particulares.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable, pues cuenta con ingresos diarios. Se decidió a empezar con éste negocio, pues necesitaba de un oficio para generarse ingresos y el deseo de apoyar con los estudios a sus hermanos menores, y brindarles las facilidades que él no tuvo.
Por tanto y viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, desea ampliarse y abrir una tienda de venta de repuestos de motos. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo de contar con una línea de crédito para continuar con sus negocios. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues los considera ser un grupo solidario y unido. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para sus vehículos como llantas, aceites y otros, para las 3 unidades, de esa manera mantener operativos sus vehículos y puedan seguir trabajando, generándoles más ingresos.
texts.en:
Maiquel, 33, is a hardworking, driven man who very much wants to get ahead.  He’s separated from his daughter’s mother.  They live in his parents’ house with his mother, father and five siblings he helps support.  Maiquel’s activity is providing transportation services and to do so he has three mototaxis that he leases to neighbors charging up to 20 soles per day.  He started very young over 7 years ago leasing a mototaxi and gradually used profits earned to pay off that vehicle until he owned it.  He then continued with the purchase of his second vehicle until owning three units.  He also studied auto mechanics so he’s able to service his own vehicle and sometimes those of individuals.

He believes that his business is quite profitable because it earns daily income.  He decided to start this business because he needed an occupation that would generate income and because he wanted to help with his younger siblings’ education and give them the opportunities he never had.

Therefore, seeing the good results he gets, he wants to expand and open a motorcycle spare parts shop.  This will be loan #5 with MFP and he feels grateful for the support of being able to rely on a line of credit to continue with his businesses.  He feels comfortable in his communal bank because he considers it to be a mutually supportive, united group.

He will uses the 1000 new soles requested to buy spare parts for his vehicles like tires, oil and others, for all three vehicles, so that they will be in operating conditions and be able to continue working generating more income for him.

loans.use: to buy tires and oil.

loans.name: Prospero Astro

texts.en:
Good management, a degree in Computer Science, plus the desire to own a business are the keys to 37-year-old Prospero Astro's success. With the help of his wife, he established a computer shop in the village 11 years ago, and they work together for its improvement.

With the goal of further expansion of his enterprise, Prospero Astro is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional computers and accessories and to pay for maintenance. His desire is to provide for all of his family's needs, especially those of his children, both of whom are currently studying.

loans.use: to purchase additional computers and accessories and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Kao, 64, married with eight children, together with her husband, has spent her life dedicated to rice farming. She has been in this business since 2002. She cultivates and harvests her rice crops twice a year. Besides rice, she sometimes grows various kinds of vegetables, potatoes and beans based on the season and market demand. 

She is taking out a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to pay for the whole process of cultivating dry-season rice and watermelon. She hopes to raise more income through the investment and thereby improve her family’s living status. In the coming years, she wants to expand her farm and further establish the family-owned business.

loans.use: to pay for the whole process of cultivating dry-season rice and watermelon.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun is 27 years old and is responsible for three school-aged children between the ages of 6 to 10. The main business activities are focused on agriculture, including crops and livestock husbandry. She is a proud farmer and enjoys her daily work a lot, although it’s such hard work at the rice field, because she wants to achieve her dream of being a successful entrepreneur, uplifting her family out of poverty and ensuring a bright future for their three children. Soun’s spouse is helpful to her and involved in the same business as her. Together, they can make around USD 10 per day through the business.

Soun now would like to have these funds to pay for whole process of planning potatoes in the up-coming season. This loan will enable her make a stable business and further develop it towards a positive goal. In the future, Soun wants to save some money to renovate her house because it’s too old and is becoming less comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to pay for whole process of planning potatoes in the up-coming season.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46, married and has eight school-aged children. They live happily in their village, planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale. Due to high cost of food and school fees, Leonora engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She has been in this business for almost 10 years and usually earns profits of P8,000 a month that she utilizes for their food and allowances for their children. 

She aims to improve her business and increase her income but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional amount of P34,000 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will enable her to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Penn

texts.en:
Penn is a 30-year-old married woman who has been residing in Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She earns a living in a fair way, dedicated to rice farming. She has been with this business for almost 20 years. She is a diligent farmer who pays careful attention to her crops. She balances the water in field, provides fertilizers and pesticides to ensure a good harvest. Penn has had to try to work harder to raise five children alone since she divorced her spouse. Two of her daughters now work for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city and share their incomes to help the family as well.

In addition to her normal income and using her second loan, Penn would like to start up a small retail business out of her home. She will buy the first stock of merchandise to make her new business run. It’ll be a great help for Penn to attain her dream. In the future, Penn wants to renovate her house and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to start up a retail business from her home.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Orlando, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca.  Sus deseos de mantener la estabilidad familiar mantiene con muchas energías a Elena, quien se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, su trabajo consiste en criarlos en un corral que tiene, que por falta de espacio disponible en su casa, colocó en el patio de la casa de uno de sus familiares. Elena es una madre de familia muy dedicada a sus hijos,  razón por la cual ha decidió criar cerdos en la casa cercana a un familiar y de esa manera generar más ingresos para su familia, su deseo es poder tener una granja más grande que le permita obtener  un incremento para mejorar la satisfacción de las necesidades de sus hijos,  es por ello que sigue  en esta humilde ocupación.
