Sok wants to acquire a loan of 600 USD to build a toilet made of bricks in her backyard to maintain a healthy living. Her business goal is to secure her family out of poverty. This is her third cycle loan from HKL. She has never made any late payment of loans and has already paid off her loans.

loans.use: to build a toilet made of bricks in her backyard to maintain a healthy living.

loans.name: Dieu D'israel Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel est le coordinatrice de son groupe Dieu D'Israel. Il  est  marié  et  il  a 3 enfants.

Emmanuel habite dans la région Ferrier Nord’est  d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il a dirigé son  commerce pendant les 7 dernières années.

Emmanuel voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à vendre le commerce du cosmetique. Des autres membres de Dieu D'Israel ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et produits divers.

Emmanuel dit que son défi principal est devenir un grand commercant et son but  principal  son rêve est aider votre famille à faire face.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is the coordinator of his group, Dieu D'Israel (God of Israel). He is married with three children.
 
Emmanuel lives in the region of Ferrier in the Nord-Est Department of Haiti, where electricity is scarce and water is very limited. He has run his business for the past seven years.
 
Emmanuel would like to use this loan to invest in his cosmetics business. Other members of Dieu D'Israel need loans for businesses selling miscellaneous products and charcoal.
 
Emmanuel says that his main goal is to become a successful businessperson, and that his biggest dream is to help his family survive.

loans.use: produits de beauté

loans.name: Sorphea

texts.en:
Sorphea, pictured, is 30 years old, and her husband, Soknan, is 32 years old. They live in a village outside Phnom Penh City and they have one son who is in school and one daughter who is still young.

Sorphea is a garment worker, and her husband sells mangoes. He buys mangoes from his fellow villagers under contract; this means that he pays money before the harvesting season and then he collects mangoes to sell at Phnom Penh market.

Sorphea is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to help fund capital for her husband to purchase mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.use: To help her husband to purchase mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Toem is 52 years old and a resident from Baray district of Kompong Tom province, where she grows rice twice a year. She has worked in this business alongside her husband to generate their livelihoods. For her bad luck, last year there was much rain and a small flood came and destroyed her rice crops. However, Toem has a strong commitment in her business without looking back to her past. Recently, she has been preparing her land again to start planting her dry season rice with the funds she has received from HKL. She will use it to pay for a plowing fee and buy seeds and organic fertilizers to put in her two-hectare farmland. Nowadays she lives with her husband and five single children in her own home.

loans.use: to pay for a plowing fee and buy seeds and organic fertilizers to put in her two-hectare farmland.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un, age 43, is a local rice farmer as well as a fish seller in a local market in Kompong Speu province, earning a net profit of 2 USD through selling activity. She is married with 4 children, two of whom are married and the other two are single. 

She is taking out a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase a secondhand motorbike to better her living condition. This vehicle will be used to support her selling business as well, without taking other motor-taxi services as in previous times. She hopes she will be able to renovate her present house one day because it has become too old now.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorbike to better her living condition.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak, age 64, is a responsible and industrious mother who always takes care of her family and provides good education to her children. She cultivates rice on her inherited farmland from Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is married to her spouse who provides construction service to people around and out of the province. He specializes in constructing wooden houses. This couple has been blessed with 4 children. They all are married and have independent living.
 
As of now, Prak is seeking for a loan in the sum of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase construction supplies to support her husband’s current business. For her prospect, she wants to save money to further develop her husband’s business and replace her roof with tiles.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to support her husband’s current business.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann is a 40-year-old married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She earns a living in a fair way by being dedicated to rice farming along with her supportive husband. She has engaged in this business since 1990. She has two school-age children who are studying in local public schools.

To add to her normal income, Vann would like to use her first loan to buy cashew nuts in bulk during the harvesting season, which are lower than the market price, and then she’ll sell them at a profitable price in the future. With the income she’ll generate, Vann will save it for her children’s future education.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk for future sale.

loans.name: Yhonny

texts.es:
Yhonny de 28 años, convive con Edith con quien tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 6 años, Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro – Satipo. Yhonny es un hombre dedicado y meticuloso. Su actividad económica es la agricultura. Inició su vida de responsabilidades al ver nacer a su primer hijo, desde entonces adquirió terrenos de cultivos para la producción de café, cacao y plátano. Ahora cuenta con 3 parcelas bien distribuidas. “El kilo de café lo vendo a 11 soles, cosecho 8 sacos de 70 kilos cada uno, si es rentable”, comenta contento. 
Junto a Edith trabajan la tierra, pero como las labores son arduas, tiene que contratar a personal extra. Así optimiza los cuidados de sus sembríos. 
El principal problema de Yhonny era la falta de capital, pero gracias a su trabajo y constancia, supo ahorrar y adquirir buenas parcelas de tierras fértiles. En su comunidad no utilizan fertilizantes, es una ventaja a su favor. Espera continuar con esta actividad para educar adecuadamente a sus menores hijos. Ésta sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se muestra alegre de formar parte de un grupo de personas conocidas cuyos objetivos son similares. Se compromete a pagar con puntualidad los pagos mensuales. “Inkani” es el nombre de su grupo. Con el dinero que obtendría podrá pagar los servicios de los jornaleros que trabajarán en la limpieza y cuidados de sus cultivos de café y cacao.
texts.en:
Yhonny, age 28, lives with Edith and their four children, ages 12, 10, 8, and six.  They all live in their own house in the native community of Yavirironi in the Río Negro – Satipo district.

Yhonny is a dedicated and meticulous man.  His business activity is farming.  He began his life of responsibilities upon seeing his first child born.  Since then he acquired some land for planting coffee, cacao, and bananas.  He now has three well-distributed parcels.  “I sell a kilo of coffee for 11 soles, I harvest 8 sacks that are each 70 kilos, and it is profitable,” he happily comments.

He works the land together with Edith.  However, the work is arduous, and he has to hire extra personnel.  That way he optimizes the care of his plants.

Yhonny’s main problem is the lack of capital.  However, thanks to his work and perseverance he knew how to save and get good parcels of fertile land.  In his community they do not use fertilizer, which is an advantage.  He hopes to continue with this business activity in order to adequately educate his minor children.

This will be his first loan with MFP.  He is happy to be part of a group of people that he knows and who have similar objectives.  He pledges to make his monthly payments punctually.  

Inkani is the name of his group.  With the money that he will get he will be able to pay the day workers who will clear the weeds and take care of his café and cacao crops.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem is sixty-one and a married woman who has been blessed with four children, living together with her family in Kompong Speu province. She was born and grew up there on a family farm. Therefore, she has learned how to cultivate rice from her ancestors. Her spouse also works in this business, from which they can make a suitable income to live on.

Since her house has become too old and there are some broken parts which need to be repaired, this family does not feel comfortable living there anymore. For this reason, Khem is taking out a loan from HKL to supplement her capital to renovate her house. She hopes that our lenders won’t reject her first loan and she is very grateful for your generosity and kindness.

loans.use: to supplement her capital to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
The hog raising business is priority business for Prak, fifty-two, a widowed woman who has been living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Besides looking after her pigs, Prak takes time to sell Khmer noodles to the local people for additional income. She has one single child and two married children. All of them can live independently without any support from her.

With the sum of KHR 1,000,000, Prak will buy five piglets and sacks of feed to maintain the stability of her business. She hopes that this loan will be given to her to improve her business capacity. Her future goal is to open a general store and sell mixed merchandise to local people in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy five piglets and sacks of feed to maintain the stability of her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month for these activities. 

Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nenita is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different products that she can offer in the community.

loans.use: to buy canned-goods, snack foods and spices for her store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has been managing a village store for almost a year now. She buys her goods from Cauayan once a week, to reduce her transportation expenses. Her business is a good source of income for her family as it is where they get their daily allowance. She hopes that her business will become more successful with the help of the loan she is requesting. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her PHP 5,000 to use as additional revolving capital for her business. She plans to buy additional commodities such as snack foods, drinks and other products that her customers may need. 

Evelyn is the kind of a businesswoman who is very optimistic. She always takes everything positively, especially when it comes to her store. She anticipates that her retail store will expand with the help of Kiva lenders, that’s why she really prays that her loan request will be granted. Evelyn is already married. She and her husband have already been blessed with a child who is presently studying. She wishes to give her child everything that she needs, thus she works diligently to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, vinegar, flour and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom, age 62, is widowed with two married sons. She lives in a village about 15 kilometers form Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sarom is a farmer. She is asking for her first loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for her son for commuting. She will also use a part of the loan to build shelter to shade her vegetables from sunlight.

In the photo, Sarom is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son for commuting and to build shelter to shade her vegetables from sunlight.

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran, the mother of three children, two of whom are at home and unemployed, is a widow who lost her husband suddenly a few years ago, necessitating her entry into the world of work as a daily wage laborer. Due to financial constraints, she was unable to provide her children with an education.

Sardaran is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son’s scrap-selling business. He will use the loan to purchase scrap in bulk, thereby enabling him to complete larger orders on time and increase his sales and income. A very positive lady, she is confident that he will be able to improve his business as a result of the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Sardaran.

loans.use: to buy scrap for her son's scrap-selling business.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas is a 41-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She was born and raised there on the family farm. Her common crop is rice, which she cultivates and harvests twice a year. She has become a single mother and is responsible for three school-aged children.

Meas would like to increase her rice production to provide economic stability for her family. Now she is requesting a loan from HKL, a Kiva partner, to buy mineral fertilizers to keep her rice crops in good condition. She aspires to give the best education possible to her children as her legacy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers to keep her rice crops in good condition.

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Sambat and her husband, Say, are fishermen. They fish from the nearby lake and sell their catch in Prek Phnao market. In addition, they are also rice farmers during rice farming season. The couple has been married since 1987 and they have two sons and two daughters. One of the children has full-time employment and the other three attend school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sambat previously asked for a Kiva loan. She is now asking for another loan of USD $1,500 to buy a boat and to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To buy a boat and to repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, pictured here, is 47 years old and her husband, Chekriya, is 49 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have two married daughters.

Srey stays at home. The main source of income is the salary of her husband, who is driver. She is asking for a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, a 41-year-old businesswoman residing with her family in the village of Cabaruan, province of Isabela, is a married mother of three children who are all studying. She says that no matter how big the trials are that arise, she is always optimistic in helping her husband provide for their daily needs, especially in regard to the education of their children.

Imelda, who raises hogs, is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed to sustain their healthy development, and hopes to soon purchase another one to raise. She is striving to uplift her family’s general living conditions, and with the help of her husband and the generosity of lenders, Imelda believes that someday she will succeed.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat has requested a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her husband’s auto workshop business.

With the loan investment, he will buy tires and repairing tools that will allow him to provide better quality repair services to his customers and improve his business.

He is very good at his work and has great technical skills. Farhat is confident that her husband’s business will become more profitable after the loan investment.

Farhat is the mother of two sons. Both of them are studying in a nearby school. She is also a very hardworking lady and works as a lady health worker in her region.

She is confident that her family’s financial future will be improved after investing the loan into her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy tires and repairing tools for her husband's auto workshop business.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn is 32 years old and is married. She has been managing her hog raising business since 2007. Khorn describes herself as a low-educated woman but is patient and conscientious. She also acts as a homemaker who always takes care of her six children, who attend school. 

Her business serves as a source of income for the family and helps her provide for their daily needs. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy 12 piglets and sacks of feed for raising her piglets. She wants to develop her business, to earn a higher income and save some of it for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy 12 piglets and sacks of feed for raising her piglets.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 45-year-old woman from the village of Cabaruan. She is married and has six school-age children.  

Zenaida owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, her primary source of income is derived from selling personal products, such as products from Avon, Natasha, and Marikina Shoe Exchange (MSE), in her local community. Zenaida has been engaged in this business for over two years, and she earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.

Zenaida is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional products that she can display in her store. In turn, she expects to be better able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl de 51 años, tiene 2 hijas de 16 y 13 años; por distintos problemas se separó de su esposa. Él vive con sus hijas en una casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro – Satipo. Raúl es un hombre valiente. La separación de su esposa no fue motivo para dejar de laborar en lo que más le gusta hacer. Él es agricultor hace más de 30 años. 
Posee una parcela de terrenos fértiles, ahí tiene sembradas plantaciones de café y cacao, cuyos frutos los cosecha una vez al año.
Para ello debe dedicar tiempo, esfuerzo y dinero, para asegurar el sano crecimiento. Cuando el trabajo de sus campos cesa, Raúl labora en otros cultivos como jornalero. Así obtiene más ingresos para sus gastos diarios y otro porcentaje para sus ahorros.
Además instaló un amplio pozo de agua donde cría peces (“Carpa” y “Lamitara”), los que vende para a restaurantes de comida típica.
Raúl cuida a sus 2 hijas. Espera que más adelante ellas sean mujeres de bien. Por su parte él trabajará como lo hace, para asegurarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Raúl piensa adquirir otra parcela para cultivar más productos. Tendrá que ahorrar para comprarse un terreno. Éste sería su primer crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales, “Inkani” es el nombre de su banco comunal integrado por personas amables y laboriosas como él.
Invertirá el dinero en el pago del personal quienes realizarán la limpieza y mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café. Además comprará machetes para esta actividad.
texts.en:
Raúl is 51 years old and has two daughters, ages 16 and 13.  Due to various issues he is separated from his wife.  He lives with his two daughters in a home of his own, located in the Yavirironi community within the Río Negro – Satipo district.  Raúl is a brave man.  Separating from his wife did not discourage him from doing what he most enjoys.  He‘s been a farmer for more than 30 years.

He has a parcel of fertile land where he has planted coffee and cacao, which he harvests annually.

For this he must dedicate time, effort, and money to ensure a healthy growth.  When he finishes working on his own land, he works as a field hand on another plantation.  In this way he is able to obtain more income for his daily expenses and a percentage that goes to his savings.

He also set up a large pond where he farms fish (Carp and Lamitara), which he sells to restaurants.

Raúl cares for his two daughters and hopes that they will become women of means in the future.  For his part he will continue to work as he has been so that he can ensure that they have a good quality of life.

Raúl wants to acquire another parcel to cultivate more products.  He will have to save up to buy a plot of land.  This will be his first loan through MFP, and he is committed to making his monthly payments on time.

“Inkani” is the name of his communal bank and is made up of friendly working people; like him.

He will use the money from this loan to pay for field hands to care for and maintain his coffee crop.  He will also buy machetes for this job.

loans.use: to pay for field hands.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny is 42 years old and her husband, Chea, is 43 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have two sons and one daughter.

Vanny is a farmer, while her husband is a motor taxi driver and assists his wife when he is free. She is asking for a loan of $1,500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her farm.

In the photo, Vanny is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena, de 32 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Antonio, su esposo desde hace 12 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Daniel y Oder; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Cullpa Alta.  Hace 4 años que se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Abrió un espacio en su casa donde acondicionó una tienda de comestibles, primero comenzó vendiendo alimentos necesarios como pan, leche, arroz y azúcar; con el tiempo incorporo carnes y verduras. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos para poder traer diversos alimentos y así mantener a sus clientes contentos. Sabe que lo conseguirá pues es una mujer luchadora. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, construyendo diversas casas. Ahora concentra toda su energía en la compra de útiles para sus hijos, que comenzaran a estudiar. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Manos fuertes” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Milena de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de cerveza para su tienda de comestible.
texts.en:
Milena, who is 32 years old, is a hard-working woman.  She lives in the company of her husband of 12 years, Antonio.  They have 2 children: Daniel and Oder, who they take care of in the home that they own in the neighborhood of Cullpa Alta.  Milena has made her living selling basic needs products for the last 4 years.  She opened up a space in her house and equipped it to be a small grocery.  At first she sold basic foodstuffs like bread, milk, rice and sugar.  With time, she incorporated meats and vegetables.  Now she hopes to improve her earnings to be able to bring in various food items and keep her customers happy.  She knows what she will achieve, as she is a determined woman.  In addition to her income, her husband contributes with his work as a bricklayer building various houses.  Now Milena is concentrating all her energy in the purchase of school supplies for her children, who have started school.  Milena belongs to the communal bank “Manos fuertes” (Strong Hands), and this is her second loan with MFP.  She feels well-developed with her bank, as she receives the help she needs to keep making progress with her business.  And so she promises to be punctual in the repayment of her loan.  In addition, she likes working with her communal bank as the members are responsible and supportive people.
When she receives her assistance, Milena will invest the requested money in the purchase of beer for her small grocery.

loans.use: to purchase beer for her store.

loans.name: Suny

texts.en:
Suny, pictured, is 32 years old and her husband, Sothea, is 33 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2004 and just have one young daughter.

Suny sells rice, food, and desserts at a local school, while her husband is a rice farmer. Suny has previously asked for a Kiva loan. She is now asking for her second loan in the amount of $500 to buy her neighboring land to expand her land property.

loans.use: To purchase neighboring land to expand her land property.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de alegre y sociable.  Es viuda y vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 22 y 17 años de edad respectivamente, habitando cómodamente una casa que es alquilada. Luzmila, se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, contando con un taller de confesión de ropas para damas caballeros y niños, también lencería, lo instaló en la casa alquilada que habita, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comenzar con su negocio. Es así que compró una pequeña maquina de coser con su propio capital, desde entonces realiza  confesiones a sus vecinos y amigas, así logro hacerse conocida y ganarse más clientes, logrando crecer y comprar más maquinas que facilitan su trabajo y mejorar los acabados.
Viene realizando ésta actividad desde hace más de 15 años, contando con la ayuda de su sobrina a la que paga por semana trabajada. Le gusta su actividad  porque le gusta elaborar nuevos diseños, así como atender a sus clientes, ya que considera que con una buena atención sus clientes volverán a pedirle más confesiones, así como también traerán más clientes por recomendación, de esa manera obtendrá más ganancias. Ahora tiene planes de abrir una boutique en ese mismo lugar. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado, para así poder avanzar con su negocio y concretar sus planes. Por tanto, comenta será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas con los créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para confesión de ropa como  telas, hilos, botones y otros,  buscando precios más cómodos para tener un stock de materiales disponible, así atender los pedidos que tiene pendiente por entregar.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 46, is a hardworking, enterprising woman besides being cheerful and sociable.  She’s a widow and lives comfortably in a rented house with her two children who are 22 and 17 years old respectively.  

Luzmila makes clothes; she has a dressmaking shop where she makes clothes for women, men and children.  She also makes lingerie.  She set it up in her house.  It’s an occupation she learned studying at an occupational education center to then start her business.  This is how she bought a small sewing machine with her own capital and since then has been making clothes for her neighbors and friends.  She became well-known and won over more customers managing to grow and purchase more machines that make her work easier and produce better finishing touches.

She has been doing this work for more than 15 years; a niece helps her and she pays her weekly.  She likes her activity because she likes making new designs and taking care of customers because she believes that with good customer service her customers will return to ask for more items as well as recommend her to others and she will earn more profits this way.  She now plans to open a boutique in the same place.

This would be loan #3 with MFP.  She feels grateful for the granted loan to be able to advance with her business and make her plans a reality.  She comments that she will be responsible with the payment of her installments like she was with past loans.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy sewing supplies like fabric, thread, buttons and others, looking for the best prices so that she can have available stock to fill the pending orders she has to deliver.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y emprendedora, le gusta los nuevos desafíos.  Es conviviente con  Abel quien es padre de sus dos hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad respectivamente. Viven juntos en compañía de  un sobrino, al cual apoyan con su educación. La actividad que realiza Carmen es la costura oficio que aprendió con su madre desde muy joven y ahora, le sirve para generarse un ingreso económico, realizándolo desde su propio hogar. También se dedica a  la compra  y venta de semillas,  las cuales adquiere a los productores y los envía fuera de la región a pedido.
Lleva dedicándose a la costura desde hace diez años y sin ayuda de nadie mas que ella sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la cantidad de clientela le dejan buenas ganancias.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad, es que le genera ingresos económicos para poder pagar sus gastos, así como también el relacionarse con más personas. Tiene planes de ampliar y mejorar su negocio comprando una maquina de coser semindustrial. Este seria el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que segura contando con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio y concertar sus planes de negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos y otros, en mayores cantidades, para así poder tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 40, is a hardworking, cheerful, enterprising woman.  She likes new challenges.  She lives with Abel who is the father of her two children who are 14 and 13 years old respectively.  They live together with a nephew too whose education they support.  

Carmen’s activity is clothes making, an occupation she learned from her mother when she was young and that now is her source of income; she works from home.  She also is a seed merchant; she buys from producers and ships them outside the region on order.  She has been sewing alone for ten years with no help from anyone.  She believes that her business is quite profitable because the high number of customers produces good profits.

What she likes about her activity is that it generates income to pay her expenses as well as it’s an opportunity to relate to more people.  She plans to expand and improve her business buying a semi-industrial sewing machine.

This would be loan #2 with MFP.  She’s happy to know that she will continue to have financial support to advance with her business and make her business plans a reality.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy sewing supplies like fabric, thread, elastic and others in larger amounts in order to earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor de 46 años, convive Nelly, la madre de sus 5 hijos de 17, 14, 12, 7 y 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Héctor es un hombre responsable. 30 años de trabajo en el campo le sirvieron para calificarse como un agricultor experto. 
Siembra cacao y yucas; en todo este tiempo le  esta yendo bien. Ambos productos son cuidados y mantenidos en todo el año, ya que las cosechas son anuales.
Lo que le conviene producir es el cacao, por la demanda que existe en su distrito.
Las yucas las ofrece por arrobas, cada una a 8 ó 9 soles. Héctor sale a las calles de mercado para expender este tubérculo al menudeo.
De esa manera logra obtener los ingresos suficientes para mantener a su numerosa familia. Él y Nelly tienen muchos planes en mente, uno de ellos es iniciar cultivos de café, así asegurarán una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Yavirironi es una zona propicia para la producción de frutos orgánicos, por eso cree que la siembra de café no tendrá pierde. Héctor recibiría su primer crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Está emocionado del trabajo que desplegará con sus compañeros del reciente creado banco comunal “Inkani”.
Invertirá el dinero en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza y mantenimiento de sus cultivos de cacao y yuca.
texts.en:
Héctor, who is 46 years old, lives with Nelly, the mother of his 5 children.  Their children are 17, 14, 12, 7 and 4 years old.  They live in the home that they own in the rural community of Yavirironi, Río Negro District, Satipo Province.  Héctor is a responsible man.  Thirty years working in the fields have earned him qualification as an expert farmer. 
Héctor plants cacao and yucca.  In all this time, it has gone very well for him.  Both products are cared for and maintained all year round, and the harvests are annual.
Producing cacao works best for him because of the demand for it in his district.
The yucca is sold per "arroba" (a unit of weight), 8 or 9 soles for each one.  Héctor frequently goes into the market streets to sell this tuber.
In this way, he is able to earn enough income to support his large family.  He and Nelly have a lot of plans in mind, one of which is to start planting coffee.  This would assure them a better quality of life for their family.  Yavirironi is an opportune area for producing profits from the earth, and so they believe that they can't lose with planting coffee.  This will be Héctor's first loan with MFP, and so he promises to be punctual with his monthly payments.  He is excited about the work that will unfurl with the other members of the recently started communal bank “Inkani”.
Héctor will invest the money in paying the day laborers that he will contract to clean and take care of his cacao and yucca plants.

loans.use: to contract day laborers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 30 years old, and she works hard to earn a living. She is happily married to a farmer. The couple are blessed with three children.

Marites owns her variety store, and she has had this business for three years. She is aiming to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customer demand, but her income is insufficient. In regards to this, she is asking for a loan amount of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She will be using her requested loan to buy canned goods, bread, and kitchen ingredients to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marites believes that her sacrifices will lead her to reach her goal, which is to increase her profit and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bread, and kitchen ingredients to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 54 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, carismática, con ganas de superación. Es conviviente con Francisco quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es padre de sus 3 hijos Freddy de 33, Francisco de 26, Maria de 23 y  nieto de 3 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho y son su inspiración para seguir adelante. Viven en su casa propia lo cual lo construyo con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo que realiza Carmen es la venta de ropas de segundo uso para damas, caballeros y niños, para toda ocasión, lo cual lo realiza desde su casa propia y un puesto en el mercado, siendo muy solicitada por los vecinos de la zona, amistades y familiares. Toda su mercadería lo compra en la capital. Esta actividad lo empezó con un propio capital, y en ocasiones cundo no puede viajar los productos los envía un familiar de la capital, ahorrándose gastos de viaje y obteniendo mayor ganancia.
Esta actividad lo viene realizando sola hace más de  8 años tiempo en el cual llegó a hacerse conocida, logrando hacer crecer su cartera de clientes habituales y hasta el momento le viene apoyando su hija.
Asimismo, considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda de sus productos llegando a vender todo lo que tiene disponible. 
Por otro lado, comenta que se inició en éste negocio por el deseo de contar con un ingreso propio, sentirse independiente y no depender de los ingresos de su pareja, así como el poder apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar. Logrando buenos resultados, espera que su negocio crezca y con las ganancias abrir una bodega de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Comenta estar agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas con lo ha venido haciendo en los créditos anteriores, así tener un buen record crediticio y acceso a más créditos en el futuro. Con el monto solicitado de 4000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de su mercadería, como ropa de segundo uso de diversas tallas y modelos, para damas, caballeros y niños. Toda está mercadería la comprará en volumen, buscando precios bajos por sus compras, de esa manera tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen, 54, is an enterprising, charismatic woman with the desire for self-improvement.  She lives with Francisco, who works in civil construction, and is the father of her three children, Freddy, 33, Francisco, 26 and María, 23, and with a three year old grandson who she loves very much and inspires her to continue forward.  They live in their own house which she built with support from her spouse.

Carmen works selling second hand clothes for all occasion for women, men and children; she does this both at home and in a stand in the market.  She is highly sought after in the zone by friends and family.  She buys all her merchandise in the capital.  She started the business with her own capital and sometimes when she can’t travel a relative sends her the merchandise from the capital saving on travel expenses and earning more profits.

She’s been carrying out this activity by herself for more than 8 years and has become well-known and has been increasing the number of her regular customers; her daughter has been helping to date.  She also considers the business to be very profitable because of the profits it produces and because of high demand for her products; she often selsl out everything she has available.

On the other hand, she comments that she started the business wanting to earn her own income, to feel independent and not be dependent on her spouse’s income as well as being able to help him meet household expenses.  Attaining good results, she hopes her business will grow so that she can use profits to open a grocery store at home.

This will be loan #2 with MFP.  She comments that she’s grateful for the opportunity of being able to rely on this line of credit to make her plans a reality.  Therefore, she commits to make her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans to have good credit history and access to more future loans.

She will use the requested 4000 new soles entirely in the purchase of merchandise like second hand clothes in assorted sizes and styles for women, men and children.  She will buy all of this merchandise in volume looking for the lowest prices for her purchases so that her profits will be higher.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther de 40 años convive con Félix, tiene 8 hijos, pero solo vive con 5 de ellos, cuyas edades varían entre los 18 y 3 años de edad. Todos ellos habitan en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro – Satipo. Esther es una mujer organizada y trabajadora. Se dedica a ala agricultura hace más de 20 años. Cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos, en cada una de ellas siembra café, cacao y achiote. La producción de estos 3 productos son más rentables, pero su cosecha es anual. Esther cultiva sus campos de tal manera que coincidan las fechas de cosechas en meses donde sus gastos son mayores; por ejemplo, el café lo cosecha en mayo y junio; el cacao en abril, mayo y junio; y el achiote en octubre y noviembre. Así no le falta dinero, para invertir en otras siembras.
“Hace 10 años cultivo café. Ahora cosecho 12 sacos; el cacao me arroja 350 kilos al año”, dice.
Uno de sus problemas es la baja de precios. El achiote llega a costar a 4 soles por kilo, pero en fechas propicias cuesta a 7 u 8 soles. Pero gracias a sus otros sembríos puede compensar dicho inconveniente.
Ahora piensa renovar sus cultivos de café, con una plantación nueva de cafetales pequeños. Éste sería su primer crédito que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Está contenta de formar parte del banco comunal “Inkani”, cuyos integrantes son personas responsables.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 10,000 plantitas de café para renovar sus cultivos. Con lo restante pagará los servicios de los jornaleros quienes la apoyarán en esta ardua labor.
texts.en:
Esther, who is 40 years old, lives with Félix.  She has 8 children but only lives with 5 of them, whose ages range from 18 to 3 years old.  They all live in the home that she owns in the rural community of Yavirironi, Río Negro Distrcit – Satipo.  Esther is an organized and hardworking woman.  She has been making her living in agriculture for more than 20 years.  She has 3 plots of land on which she plants coffee, cacao and annatto.  Producing these three products is very profitable, but each harvest is annual. Esther plants her fields in such a way that the harvests coincide with the months of greatest expense.  For example, she harvests the coffee in May and June, the cacao in April, May and June and the annatto in October and November.  That way they have the money to invest in other plantings.
“I have been farming coffee for 10 years.  Now I am harvesting 12 sacks.  The cacao gives me 350 kilos a year,” she says.
One of her problems is low prices.  Annatto is getting 4 soles per kilo, but in better times gets 7 or 8 soles per kilo.  Thanks to her other crops, she can compensate for said inconvenience.
Esther is currently thinking of renewing her coffee crop with a new crop of small coffee plants.  This will be her first loan from MFP, and so she promises to be punctual with her monthly payments.  She is happy to be a part of the communal bank “Inkani”, whose members are responsible people.
Esther will invest the money in the purchase of 10,000 little coffee plants to renew her crop.  With the rest, she will pay the day laborers who will help her with this strenuous work.

loans.use: to purchase 10,000 little coffee plants.

loans.name: Blanca Ines

texts.es:
Blanca es una persona que a pesar de todas las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando. Blanca es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 3 hijos de 15, 14 y 2 años de edad, pues el padre de sus hijos murió hace poco tiempo y ella quedo a cargo de ellos. A sus hijos siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso, por lo que trabaja fuertemente en su negocio todos los días. Blanca en un principio inició su negocio de confección con el ánimo de contribuir junto con su esposo a los ingresos de su hogar, sin embargo, luego de la muerte de su esposo, esta es la fuente de ingresos que le ha permitido sacar su familia adelante. Blanca montó su negocio hace aproximadamente 6 años luego de trabajar durante un largo tiempo para una empresa que se dedicaba a esta actividad. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos su negocio ha ido creciendo rápidamente, y ahora requiere contratar una persona. Es por esto que Blanca busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina recubridora, una máquina fileteadora y una mesa de trabajo para poder ofrecer las herramientas necesarias a la persona que contratará en su negocio.

Blanca espera que de esta manera pueda mejorarle la calidad de vida a une persona diferente a su familia y que este sea el comienzo de una gran generación de empleo en su taller. Además, Blanca espera que con mayores ingresos sus hijos puedan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. Blanca tiene el sueño de que su negocio le brinde la posibilidad de comprar su casa propia, ofrecerle a sus hijos una educación de calidad, y poder dejarles una estabilidad económica que les permita progresar.
texts.en:
Blanca’s a person who despite all the adversities life has presented her has had the strength to continue forward making progress.  Blanca’s a head of household, single mother of three children who are 15, 14 and 2 years old because the father of her children died a short while ago and she was left in charge of them.  She’s always wanted to provide her children with a good quality of life and greater opportunities for progress so she works hard at her business every day.  

At the beginning, Blanca started her clothes making business aiming to help her husband meet household expenses.  However, after his death this is the source of income that has allowed her to support her family.  

Blanca set up the business about 6 years ago after having worked for a long time for a firm that did this type of work.  Thanks to the good quality of her items her business has grown quickly and she now requires employing a person.  This is why Blanca is looking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy an overlock sewing machine and a serger sewing machine and a work table to have the necessary work tools available for the person she’s going to hire for her business.

Blanca hopes that she will be able to improve the quality of life of someone outside her family and that this will be the beginning of great employment generation in her shop.  Blanca also hopes that with greater income her children will enjoy a better quality of life and greater opportunities to make progress.  Blanca dreams that someday her business will provide her with the opportunity to buy a house of her own, to offer her children a quality education and to produce economic stability that will allow them to progress.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Claudia Janet

texts.es:
Claudia es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. Claudia se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 15 años de edad, a quienes siempre ha querido ofrecerles una buena calidad de vida. Claudia vive en un sector de su ciudad que es fuertemente golpeado por la violencia, y con el ánimo de estar más tiempo pendiente de sus hijos decidió retirarse de su empleo y estar en casa para su cuidado. Claudia trabajó durante 8 años para una empresa de confección, y gracias a esto adquirió un gran conocimiento para llevar la actividad a cabo. Debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no eran suficientes para sostener los gastos de su hogar, Claudia decidió montar un taller de confección en su vivienda, de modo que pudiera estar al cuidado de sus hijos y generando ingresos en el mismo lugar. Ya ha pasado aproximadamente 1 año desde que Claudia montó su taller de confección y ya ha logrado tener una gran cantidad de clientes. Con el ánimo de comprar insumos que requiere en su taller, Claudia busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de hilos, telas, agujas, entre otros insumos que requiere en su taller de confección.

Claudia espera que de esta manera su taller siga creciendo y cada vez captando más clientes. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida. Claudia sueña con que su negocio crezca y este le permita adquirir una vivienda en un sector con mejores condiciones de vida, y de esta manera le pueda ofrecer a sus hijos mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Claudia is a person who has always been noted for being very hardworking and always wanting to provide a better quality of life and greater opportunities for progress for her family.  Claudia is married and has two children who are 5 and 15 years old who she has always wanted to offer a better quality of life.

Claudia lives in a sector of the city that’s heavily impacted by violence and wanting to spend more time watching over her children she decided to leave her job to spend more time at home caring for them.  Claudia worked for 8 years for a clothes making firm and thanks to this acquired quite a bit of knowledge to carry out this type of work.  

Because her husband’s income was insufficient to meet all household expenses, Claudia decided to set up a sewing shop in her house so that she could take care of her children while generating income in the same place.  It’s been about a year now since Claudia set up her shop and she’s managed to acquire a large number of customers.  Claudia is looking for a loan in order to buy supplies she needs in her shop; she wants to buy thread, fabric and needles, among other supplies her sewing shop needs.

Claudia hopes that her shop will continue growing and capturing more customers this way.  She also hopes that with higher income her family can have a better quality of life.  Claudia dreams with her business growing so that she can acquire a house in a sector with better living conditions so that she can offer her children better opportunities for progress this way.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son’s embroidery business. With the loan investment, he will buy beads, embroidery material, and embroidery frames in larger quantity and of better quality which will help him producing better work and increase his profits. He is very skilful in his work; his clients are very happy with his work quality and give him regular orders.

Bashiraan is confident that a loan investment will help her son make more profits from his business. She is also the mother of four other children. Two of them work while her two daughters are studying in nearby school. Bashiraan is a great mother and takes care of her family very well. She is very much sure about her son’s business success as a result of loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy beads and embroidery frames for her son's embroidery business.

loans.name: Maria Lucelly

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando en su vida. Maria se separó de su esposo hace un largo tiempo y desde esto quedó a cargo de sus 3 hijos, por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio. Maria tiene la dificultad de que su hija menor sufre de síndrome de down, por lo que requiere estar constantemente en su cuidado. María ofrece a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos de uso personal, que van desde maquillaje, ropa, artículos personales, entre otros, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece ha podido captar una gran cantidad de clientes, lo que le garantiza tener muy buenas ventas. Con el ánimo de entregar pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal para atender los pedidos que tiene pendiente.

Maria sueña con que su negocio siga adelante y este le brinde la posibilidad de ofrecerles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Además, Maria sueña con poder tener una vivienda más grande donde puedan vivir en mejores condiciones y poder ofrecerles a sus hijos mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
María is a person who has had to go through many adversities in life. However, she’s had the strength to continue forward making progress in her life.  María separated from her husband a long time ago and since then was left in charge of her three children so she decided to start her own business.  María has a challenge in that her youngest daughter has Down’s syndrome and requires constant care.  

María offers her customers a wide variety of personal use products like make-up, clothes and personal items, among others.  Thanks to this she generates income necessary to support her home.  Thanks to the good customer service she offers she’s secured many customers which guarantee good sales.  Hoping to fill pending customer orders, María is looking for a loan to buy personal use items in order to fill her pending orders.

María dreams with her business continuing forward and that it will provide her with the opportunity to offer her three children a better quality of life.  Also, María dreams with having a larger house where they can live in better conditions and be able to offer her children greater opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to buy personal use items.

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is widow. Her husband died few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her but she never lost hope and started a business of selling bedsheets. Now her business is going very well and she has good business contacts in the market.

Nazeeran has given birth to four sons and a daughter. Her two elder sons work and her youngest son is studying. Her remaining children remain at home.

Nazeeran has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her bedsheet selling business. With the loan investment, she will buy bedsheets in larger quantities and of different varieties that will allow her to complete larger orders on time and increase her sales and profits. She is an experienced business lady and has been operating her business for some time now. She is confident that her business will become more profitable after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets for her bedsheet selling business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Yei, South Sudan. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 28 years old and is married with five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Victoria heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with two adult children. She’s a very hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and improve herself more every day.

Editha sells cosmetics and clothes. She chose this work because she enjoys selling. She’s been working for about a year and earns 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) per week. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase feed for her hog raising business to have more additional income. Editha’s main dream is to have poultry. She’s very grateful for the loan granted because she’ll be able to reach her goals with it.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hog.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatimata  appartient à la race peulh. Cette race qui a la réputation de préférer leur bétail à leur semblable. Dès leur naissance, chaque nouveau-né possède déjà un mouton ou une chèvre ou même un veau et c’est à partir de là que leur vient l’amour qu’ils vouent aux bêtes. Fatimata possède actuel ment un troupeau. Mais c’est dans le cadre de renouveler  et de remplacer les bêtes vendus qu’elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 10 chèvres et 5 moutons qu’elle va emboucher. Elle va aussi acheter de l’aliment car à cette période de l'année, il n’y a pas encore de pâturage.
Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants ; et avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle améliore les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle a comme projet futur, d’étendre son activité à un plus haut niveau, avec l’appui bien sur des préteurs.
texts.en:
Fatimata belongs to the Fula ethnic group.  The Fula people are sometimes said to prefer cattle to other human beings.  Since birth, each child already owns a sheep, a goat, or even a calf, and this is where their devotion to animals comes from.  Fatimata currently owns a herd.  But since she wants to renew her flock and replace sold livestock, she is requesting a loan to purchase 10 goats and 5 sheep which she will fatten up.  She will also buy some fodder, since the animals cannot graze yet during this time of year.
She is married and the mother of three children.  With the profits from her activity, she improves her family's living conditions.  Her future project is to raise the level of her activity, with the definite support of her lenders.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
El señor Andrés tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y procreo tres hijos, pero fueron asesinados en el conflicto armado en El Salvador. Él es una persona, honesta, responsable, trabajador, solo vive con su esposa y tienen la necesidad de construir una casa. Toda su vida él se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, fue combatiente del conflicto armado en El Salvador.

Don Andrés solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar madera, horcones, vigas, cuartones, tachuela, vara de tuza, clavos, en los que invertirá $500 dólares, 1000 tejas que cuestan $500 dólares y el resto será para pago de mano de obra.

Así él y su esposa vivirán en una casa propia, digna y segura, para continuar trabajando con la Fundación. Él desea tener una casa de bloque y trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Andrés is 60 years old, married and had three children but they were assassinated in the El Salvador armed conflict.  He is an honest, responsible, hardworking man who lives only with his wife; they need to build a house.  All of his life he’s worked in agriculture and he was a combatant in the El Salvador armed conflict.

Andrés is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy lumber, forked supports, beams, girders, tacks, poles and nails that he will spend $500 on and 1000 roofing tiles that cost $500 dollars; the rest will be used to pay labor costs.

He and his wife will live in their own, proper, secure home to continue working with the Fundación.  He wants to have a house made of blocks and to work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy builidng materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. Hace aproximadamente 2 años el esposo de Maria murió, y esta quedó a cargo de sus 7 hijos, por lo que inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que en un principio le estaba generando ganancias con las cuales podía sostener los gastos de su hogar. Posteriormente, el negocio entró en dificultades y este ya no le proporcionaba todos los ingresos que eran necesarios, por lo que empezó paralelamente a fabricar arepas, y con estos dos negocio logró generar los ingresos que necesitaba en su hogar. Con el ánimo de sacar estos negocios adelante, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para los pollos, adecuar el corral de sus pollos y comprar insumos que requiere para la elaboración de las arepas.

Maria tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita suplir sus necesidades en el corto plazo y esto le ayude a salir adelante con su negocio. Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
María is a person who has had to go through many adversities in life.  However, she’s always had the strength to overcome them and get ahead with her children.

About two years ago María’s husband died and she was left in charge of their 7 children so she desperately needed to find a source of income for her home.  This is how she started to raise chickens, a business that initially was generating income with which she could support her home.  

Later, the business started having problems and it no longer generated enough income so she also started to make “arepas “ [a flat, unleavened patty made of cornmeal which can be grilled, baked, or fried] and with the two businesses she was again able to generate the income needed for her home.  

Hoping to move both businesses forward, María seeks a loan that will make it possible for her to buy chicken feed, to repair the chicken coops and to buy the ingredients she needs to make the arepas.  María hopes that with the loan she will be able to meet her needs in the short run and be able to move forward with her business.  Also, she hopes that her business will grow and generate higher income with which she can offer her children a better quality of life and greater opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed, repair the coops and to buy ingredients to make arepas.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
Claudiana, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y dedicada con muchas ganas de progresar. Es conviviente con Lister quien es empleado y padre de su hijo Renzo de 7 años de edad. Habitando cómodamente la casa de sus suegros. La actividad que realiza Claudina es la venta de comida rápida como salchipollos, pollos broster entre otros y gaseosas, para lo cual cuenta con una carpa y mesa que instala en el frontis de la casa de sus suegros. Su actividad empieza levantándose muy de temprano, se dispone a realizar las compras necesaria, y durante las mañanas realiza la preparación de sus comidas, que luego entrado la noche, se dispone a venderlos. Cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja, quien se encarga de atender a los clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos.
Le gusta  su actividad al poder tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede pagar los gastos de su hijo, sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logrará sacar adelante a su hijo, que es su motivación, por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es el cansancio físico que tiene al finalizar cada día de trabajo, a pesar de eso tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir un local en la casa donde vive, en donde pueda atender más cómodamente a su clientes. Por otro lado desea concluir sus estudios superiores. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente emocionada con el apoyo que recibirá con un capital de trabajo para avanzar con su negocio, desea seguir contando con éste apoyo, por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, así tendrá acceso a más créditos. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas en mayores cantidades, tales como papas , aceites, harinas, pollos y demás, así espera poder comprar a menos precios, y tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Claudiana, 26, is a hard-working woman dedicated to progressing.  She lives with her partner, Lister, who is an employee and father of their son, Renzo, 7.  All live comfortably in her in-laws' house. Claudina sells fast food such as fried chicken, roasted chickens, and soft drinks, etc from a tarp and table in front of their house.  She starts very early to shop for what she needs and prepares the food in the mornings and sells it at night.  Her partner helps her by taking care of the customers who are mostly neighbors.
She likes this business because it gives her an income which she uses to pay her son's expenses.  She knows that with a lot of effort and dedication, she will get her son ahead and that is her motivation.  What she doesn't like about the work is the physical energy it takes and she ends up very tired.  Despite this she plans on expanding her business and opening a stand in the house where she lives, and thus be able to make her customers more comfortable.  On the other hand she would like to finish high school.
This is her second loan with MFP and she feels excited about the support, and she promises to be punctual with the repayment so that she can have more loans.
She will use the 2000 new sols requested to buy ingredients in larger quanities to prepare the food, such as potatoes, oil, flour, chicken and more.  That way she hopes to be able to buy at lower prices and have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, oil, flour and chickens.

loans.name: Golber

texts.es:
Golber, de 55 años de edad, es un hombre decidido y empeñoso, además de ser alegre y amable. Está casado con Loidith quien es docente y madre de  sus 4 hijos Paco de 29, Gino de 27,  Ronald de 9 y Estefita de 23 años de edad. Juntos viven en su casa propia casa que compraron y construyeron con mucho esfuerzo a los largo de los años. La actividad que realiza Golber es la venta de agua, para eso tiene un pozo tubular de 72 metros de profundidad de donde extrae agua limpia y pura, inicialmente para su uso propio, pero viendo la necesidad y solicitudes de sus vecinos de venderles, se decidió instalar tuberías para hacerlos llegar hasta sus domicilio, luego fueron viniendo más personas solicitando éste servicio, creciendo su negocio y necesitando mayor capacidad en su tanque a 1100 litros y la bomba sumergible para extraer el agua.  
Se inicio hace más de 13 años con un préstamo bancario y hasta el momento le apoyan sus hijos en el mantenimiento de las redes de tuberías y limpieza del tanque de agua.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, y la permanencia de sus clientes.
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de contar con un oficio ya que no lograba conseguir trabajo y vio la oportunidad de negocio por  la ubicación de  su casa. 
Ahora se siente más tranquilo económicamente y tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, además de construir un hospedaje en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos, de esa manera tener un buen record crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de tuberías y teflones para realizar arreglos en sus redes y ampliarlo a dos nuevos clientes que tendrán agua, así podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. También del mantenimiento de la bomba de agua sumergible.
texts.en:
Golber, 55 years old, is a determined and hard-working man, in addition to being happy and kind.  He is married to Loidith, who is a teacher and the mother of their four children: Paco, 29, Gino, 27, Ronald, 9, and Estefita, 23. Together they live in their own house, which they bought and built with much effort over the years. Golber sells water. For this, he has a tube well 72 meters deep from which he extracts clean, pure water. Initially it was for his own use, but seeing the need and the requests from his neighbors to sell it to them, he decided to install pipes to reach their houses. Then there were more people asking for this service. His business grew and he needed more capacity in his 1100-liter tank and the submersible pump to extract the water.

He started more than 13 years ago with a bank loan, and up to this point his children have helped him in maintaining all the pipe networks and cleaning the water tank. 

He considers his business to be pretty profitable because of the earnings it brings him and the permanence of his customers.

He decided to start his business because he needed a job, since he was not able to find work, and he saw the opportunity due to the location of his house. 

Now he feels better off economically and he has plans to expand his business, as well as to build guest lodgings in his home. This will be his third loan with MFP, so he hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with his goals. He promises to make his payments on time, as with previous loans, and thus have a good credit record. 

With the amount requested of 2500 nuevos soles, he will purchase pipes and teflon to make repairs to his networks and expand them to two new customers who will have water. This way, he will be able to provide better service to his customers. He will also perform maintenance on the submersible water pump.

loans.use: to purchase pipes and teflon, and to fix his water pump

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
El señor Martín tiene 74 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene ocho hijos. Desde los 10 años de edad, empezó a trabajar en la agricultura, fue su papá quien le enseño, para ayudar a mantener a la familia. Cuando él se acompaño con su pareja siempre continuo trabajando en la agricultura, con especies menores y ganado en pequeña escala.

Él compra los cerdos en las plazas de la ciudad más cercanas, debe caminar para abordar el autobús que lo conduce al tiangue y se tarda treinta minutos en llegar. Martín posee una experiencia en el engorde y venta de cerdos. El financiamiento que solicita a Fundación Campo es para comprar seis cerdos de raza, concentrado, vitaminas y desparacitantes para engordar los cerdos.

Con la inversión aumentara el número de cerdos, para engordarlos y tener más oportunidad de venderlos ya sea en la comunidad donde vive o en las plazas. Él espera por su experiencia obtener mejores ingresos económicos, pues es un negocio muy conocido por él.  Con esos ingresos desea mejorar su condición de vida y ayudar a su hija a continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martín is 74 years old.  He has a spouse and eight children.  He started working in agriculture at the age of 10.  His father taught him so that he could help support the family.  When he got together with his spouse he always continued working in agriculture, raising small farm animals, and raising cattle in small scale.

He buys pigs in the squares in nearby cities.  He must walk to catch the bus that takes him to the street markets and it takes him 30 minutes to get there.  Martín has experience in fattening up and selling pigs.  The financing he’s asking from Fundación Campo is to buy six pedigree pigs, feed concentrate, vitamins and deparasitizer to fatten up the pigs.

With the investment he will increase the number of pigs to fatten up and increase his opportunities to sell them either in the community where he lives or in the towns.  He hopes through his experience to obtain income because it’s a business that’s very well known by him.  He hopes to improve his living conditions and to help his daughter continue with her studies with this income.

loans.use: to buy six pedigree pigs, feed, vitamins and deparasitizers.

loans.name: Ditier

texts.es:
Ditter, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de ser amable y caballeroso. Es separado de la madre de sus 4 hijos: Andrea, Cintia, Gustavo y Maria de 14, 11, 7 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de sus hijos a quienes quiere  mucho y son su motivación para seguir esforzándose. La actividad que realiza Ditter  es el servicio de soldadura, oficio que aprendió de manera empírica cuando trabajaba como ayudante en un taller de soldadura. Ahora trabaja en su propio  taller que instaló en el frontis de la casa que alquila. También brinda servicio de vulcanizado de llantas vehiculares de motos y mototaxis.
Se inició en ese negocio hace más de 7 años y hasta el momento lo realiza él solo.
Considera su actividad bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y el poco tiempo que le toma realizarlo. Antes de empezar con su actividad tenía apuros económicos pues el anterior trabajo no le pagaban muy bien  y lo consideraba pesado, muchas veces pasando necesidad con su familia. 
Pero ahora con su oficio tiene mejores guanacias, con las cuales desea abrir una tienda de lubricantes y repuestos de vehículos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está contento y agradecido de saber que seguirá contando con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de un esmeril eléctrico valorizado en 150 nuevos soles,  una maquina de soldar valorizada en 17000 nuevos soles y con el saldo los materiales necesarios para la vulcanizadota de llantas.
texts.en:
Ditter, age 36, is a hard-working and diligent man.  He is also friendly and gentlemanly.  He is separated from the mother of his four children, 14 year old Andrea, 11 year old Cintia, 7 year old Gustavo, and 3 year old Maria.  He lives in a rented house with his children.  He loves them very much, and they are his motivation to continue working hard.

Ditter provides soldering services.  He learned this trade through experience when he worked as a helper in a soldering shop.  Now he works in his own shop, which he set up in the front of the house he rents.  He also provides the service of vulcanizing motorcycle and “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) tires.  He started this business over seven years ago, and so far he works alone.

He considers his business activity to be very profitable because of the good income it gives him and the small amount of time it takes to do the work.  Before he started his business activity he had financial hardships.  The previous job did not pay him very well, and he considered it to be difficult.  Many times the family was in want.

However, his job now has better income, which he wishes to use to open a store with lubricants and replacement parts for vehicles.

This will be his third loan with MFP.  He is happy and grateful to know that he can continue to count on a loan to advance with his business.  He pledges to make his payments like he did with his previous loans.  He will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy an electric grinder for 150 soles and a soldering machine for 1,700.  He will use the balance to buy the materials needed to vulcanize tires.

loans.use: to buy a soldering machine, materials to vulcanize tires, and other tools for his shop.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 40 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y honesto, está separado de su pareja por mucho años y con quien tuvo dos hijos, Rosa de 14 y Cintia de 13 años, él aunque no vive a lado de sus hijas, siempre se encarga de que no les falte nada y les brinda mucho tiempo de su parte para poder tenerlas cerca. Juan, durante mucho tiempo trabajó como obrero de construcción civil, mediante éste trabajo, logró aprender muchas cosas y gracias a éste trabajo logró comprarse una mototaxi que ahora lo utiliza como una herramienta de trabajo. Divide su tiempo de acuerdo al tipo de trabajo que tenga, en algunas ocasiones lo contratan para hacer alguna casa o proyectos de construcción y él está ahí para brindar sus servicios que son muy cómodos y buenos. Lleva 23 años realizando su trabajo de constructor, mientras que solo 20 años como mototaxista.
Le gusta su trabajo ya que puede dar empleo a otras personas cuando hay que hacer alguna obra grande y mientras no, sale a hacer su trabajo de mototaxista que también le permite tener buenos ingresos ya que siempre hay movimientos y clientes. Espera seguir trabajando y crecer día a día, en su momento desea tener maquinas de construcción para alquilar y mejorar su condición económica. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, siempre fue muy buen socio en su banco comunal en donde lo quieren mucho porque es muy responsable y solidario, espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para él y seguir aumentando sus materiales de trabajo. Está convencido que seguirá siendo un socio muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará algunos materiales que le hacen falta para continuar con su trabajo, además de algunas piezas y repuestos para su mototaxi ya que se deterioraron con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Juan, 40, is a very hardworking and honest man.  For many years he has been separated from his partner, with whom he had two children, Rosa, 14, and Cintia, 13.  Although he does not live with his daughters, he always assumed the responsibility that they not lack anything, and he gives them a lot of his time to be able to have them nearby.

For a long time Juan worked as a laborer in civil construction.  Through this job he managed to learn a lot of things and, thanks to this job, he was able to buy himself a motorcycle taxi that now he uses as a work tool.  He divides his time according to the type of work he has.  Sometimes he has a contract to work on some house or construction project, and he is there to offer very good and convenient service.  He has been doing his construction work for 23 years, while only 20 years as a motorcycle taxi driver.

He likes his job because he can give employment to other people when he has to do some big job, and, when he cannot, he goes out to do his job as a motorcycle taxi driver, which also allows him to have a good income because there is always travel and customers.  He hopes to continue working and to grow day by day.  In time he wants to have construction machines to rent and to improve his financial situation.

This will be his third loan with MFP.  He always was a good member in his communal bank where they are very fond of him because he is very responsible and supportive.  He hopes they can give him the loan, which will be support for him, and to continue expanding his work materials.

He is convinced that he will continue to be a very punctual member and that he will make his payments on time as with all the loans he had until now.  With the requested amount of 1000 soles (PEN) he will buy some materials he needs to continue with his job, as well as some components and parts for his motorcycle taxi because they deteriorated over time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials as well as spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 42 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es conviviente con Juan de 40 años y con quien tiene tres hijos, Brenda de 19, Carlos de 6 y Erick de 4, ella trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia con quienes comparten sus días en su casa propia que pudo comprar gracias a su arduo trabajo. El trabajo de Lina consiste en la venta de productos de belleza, de acuerdo a los tipos de pedidos que tenga, ella se dirige a las casas de sus clientes o espera en su casa a que vayan a escoger el color de los cosméticos, así como elegen las fragancias que ofrece a sus clientes. Lleva dos años realizando éste trabajo y los hace sola. Durante su tiempo en éste negocio, aprendió muchas cosas, desde como tratar a sus clientes y a como concretar una venta exitosa.
